El préstamo lo necesita para comprar herramientas (pintura, tubos y  soldadores) de esa forma obtendrá mejores resultados y más ingresos.
El propósito de Deni es siempre mantener su negocio estable, tener lo necesario para la vida diaria y que su familia viva en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Deni lives with his wife. He has a metal shop where he makes doors, windows, and roofing materials. He learned this trade as an apprentice and now he has his own workshop. Deni works every day, Monday through Sunday.

This loan will be used to buy equipment such as paint, pipes, and welding materials so that he can obtain better results and more income. Deni’s goals are to always maintain a stable business, to have what he needs for daily life, and to provide his family good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy paint, pipes, and welding materials.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ines; La socia tiene 31años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad; la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes y aves de corral, ella también elabora chicha a base de maíz, la socia tiene un terreno en el cual siembra y cosecha maíz amarillo para la realización de la chicha de jora o chicha de maíz fermentado; La socia también elabora comidas caseras, la socia desea invertir su crédito en la compra de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, también en la compra de arroz, azúcar al por mayor. La socia solicita el pre4stamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores para la venta y de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas típicas caseras.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”. The communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Ines.  She is 31 years old and is in a live-in relationship; she has two children aged 9 and 3.  Ines works raising small animals, specifically guinea pigs and farmyard poultry.  She also makes chicha (a local drink) from a corn base.  Ines has land where she grows and harvests yellow corn for making chicha de jora or chicha made from fermented corn.  She also makes homemade meals.

Ines wants to invest her loan in purchasing small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She also wants to use it to purchase rice and sugar at wholesale.  Ines is requesting the loan to purchase small animals for sale, and ingredients for making her typical homemade meals.

Ines is grateful for the loan, and commits to comply with her loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of small animals for sale, and ingredients for preparing her typical homemade meals.

loans.name: Erick Crisantos

texts.es: En la comarca Wiscaral localizada en las afueras de Estelí, zona conocida por sus suelos fértiles para siembra, vive Erick, de 33 años , un joven agricultor de hortalizas, casado, padre de tres hijos de 13,9 años respectivamente y el ultimo un bebe de tres meses. El empezó en este negocio desde, muy joven cuando termino su secundaria. Empezó sembrando hortalizas en las tierras de su padre, después aprendió a lidiar con el ganado, ordeñar vacas, ayudarlas a parir y criar terneros  actividades propias del campo, su familia ha sido su principal apoyo ya que son muy unidos y trabajan como un solo equipo según nos cuenta Erick. El realizo el préstamo para comprar 4 novillos para vender y reproducir. Ya que podrá reproducir un ganado de mejor calidad, porque posee buenos pastos pero no tiene muchos animales para reproducir, así que el préstamo la ayudara mucho a poder aprovechar al máximo los recursos. Su próxima meta es mejorar la raza del ganado , mejorar las condiciones de la finca.
texts.en: Erick lives in the region of Wiscaral located on the outskirts of Esteli, an area known for its fertile planting land. Erick, a young vegetable farmer, is 33 years old, married and the father of 3 children aged 13 and 9 years and a baby of 3 months. He started out in the business as a young man on finishing secondary school. He started by planting vegetables on his father's land. Later he learned to deal with livestock, milk cows, help them give birth and raise male calves, activities appropriate for the countryside. His family has been his main support as they are very close and work as one team so Erick tells us. He took the loan to buy 4 male calves for breeding and selling. He will be able to breed livestock of a better quality because has good pasture but he does not have many animals for breeding. This is why the loan will help him a lot to make full use of his resources. His next goal is to improve the breed of cattle and improve the farm's condition.

loans.use: to buy 4 male calves for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Joyreline

texts.en: Joyreline lives in West Point, Liberia, is 37 years old, married and has two children ages 11 and 16 that live at home and are presently in school.  For the past two years she has been selling rice, and she enjoys the way customers flow in to her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her  business

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
This is Mylene, 40, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rogel, her business partner, and a mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mylene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mylene dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Mira has a shop that sells fish such as sardines, trout and mackerel. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Mira has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Fabrice

texts.fr:
Client de 34 ans, celibataire avec un enfant de 6 ans, ayant fini ses etudes universitaires,et ne trouvant pas du travail dans la fonction publique, il se lance dans le commerce des tissus il ya de cela 8 ans. 
Ces successifs  prêts lui ont apportes un grand secours dans son activité, il a renforce son capital, ses épargnes sont considérables et a fait des remboursements sans défauts de paiements
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renouveler le stock de ses marchandises, surtout qu'a la veille des fêtes de fin d'année, il va acheter des tissus de qualité comme le satin, la soie, des dentelles, les tissus de cérémonies des super 100, 150 .
Il a des stratégies très efficace, il vend ses tissus chez les grands couturiers de la place, des femmes des mutuelles et associations , des maries et parfois il fait la vente dans les bureaux et va de maison en maison.

Tres entreprenant, il tient  a ouvrir une grande boutique des tissus de qualité et s' occupe valablement de son enfant.
texts.en: This borrower is 34 years old, single, and has a 6-year-old child.  Unable to find employment as a public servant after completing his university degree, he decided to start working in the fabric business 8 years ago.  His previous loan cycles have really helped his business.  He has been able to bolster his capital, has a very good amount of savings, and has been able to pay-off his loans without any problems.  With this new loan, Fabrice plans to renew his stock of merchandise, and before the Holidays he would like to buy high-quality fabrics such as satin, silk, lace and super 100 and 150 ceremonial fabrics.  He is a very efficient planner: he sells his fabrics to the best fashion designers in town, to women working in community-based health organizations and associations, to people getting married.  He also sometimes sells in offices and door-to-door.  A motivated entrepreneur Fabrice intends to open a large shop selling high-quality fabrics.  He takes good care of his child.

loans.use: To buy ceremonial fabrics, satin, silk and lace.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan is an expert in clothes sewing and decorative embroidery. Due to her good quality of work, she receives regular orders every month.

Her husband is a mason by profession and constructs houses and buildings on order. He is 60 years old and has been doing his business since his teens.

Hanifaan is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her children. Her sons work while her daughters stay at home and help Hanifaan in her daily routine tasks.

She has applied for a loan for her eldest son who is a mason. With the loan investment, he will buy masonry tools to provide better quality masonry services to his clients and increase his income.

He has been operating his business for the past many years, and Hanifaan is hopeful that an investment will help him earn better profits.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools for mason business

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Mirian tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que se dedican a estudiar.
doña Mirian es una mujer emprendedora, hace un año se vio en la necesidad de invertir en muebles de madera para ser comercializados, El esposo de Mirian tiene un taller que fabrica puertas, ventanas, mesas, sillas y otros productos mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de muebles.
El sueño de doña Mirian es que sus hijos se graduen y que su negocio sea el mejor de la zona.
texts.en: Mirian, age 40, is married and has three children who are currently studying. Mirian is an entrepreneurial woman; a year ago she decided to invest into wooden furniture in order to resell it. Her husband has a workshop which makes doors, windows, tables, chairs, and other products. Mirian will use the loan to purchase furniture. Mirian's dream is to have her children graduate and to ensure that her business is the best in the area.

loans.use: purchase wooden furniture

loans.name: Amina

texts.ru: Амина молодая жена в возрасте 23 лет. У нее есть маленький ребенок. Амина 6 лет назад решила начать зарабатывать и помочь обеспечить семью. Амина решила создать свой бизнес, она начала продавать средства гигиены и разную косметику. Амина вот уже 6 лет своей жизни продвигает данную деятельность. Она знает все тонкости своей работы. Амина хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. Она собирается увеличить ассортимент товара. Но для совершения данной операции ей не хватает средств. Амина надеется на получения кредита. Она хочет создать устойчивый бизнес добиться признания в этой сфере деятельности.
texts.en: Амина молодая жена в возрасте 23 лет. У нее есть маленький ребенок. Амина 6 лет назад решила начать зарабатывать и помочь обеспечить семью. Амина решила создать свой бизнес, она начала продавать средства гигиены и разную косметику. Амина вот уже 6 лет своей жизни продвигает данную деятельность. Она знает все тонкости своей работы. Амина хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. Она собирается увеличить ассортимент товара. Но для совершения данной операции ей не хватает средств. Амина надеется на получения кредита. Она хочет создать устойчивый бизнес добиться признания в этой сфере деятельности.

loans.use: Для купли средств личной гигиены и косметики

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is 39 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 4 and 14 years, 3 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Valentin J. is 31 years old. He has his own farming business since 2000. He breeds 27 cows and more than 40 calves in his farm. The farm is in the village of Nauchen, which is about 15 km far from Sliven. Valentin owns two cowsheds that he bought three years ago. Success of the business Valentin owns to his parents who live in the same village and help him in everything he does. To improve the quality of milk that he produces Valentin J. needs a special camera in which to preserve milk. It will cost him $ 2000.

loans.use: To buy a special camera in which to preserve milk

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 22 years of age, she is married and has a small son. She is a young woman, enthusiastic and wanting the best for her family. She wants to giver her child a life with dignity with all that he needs. She started a business selling lingerie to supplement her husband income that is insuficient to support the family.

She needs a loan of $250 to meet the demand that has recently increase. She depends on the kindness of people to those that need it most. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalinda tiene 22 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, es una mujer joven, entusiasta y que desea lo mejor para su familia. Ella quiere ofrecerle a su hijo una vida digna y darle todo lo que necesita, por lo que inició con la venta de ropa interior, pues el ingreso que recibe su esposo es insuficiente para el sustento de su familia.

Ella necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que necesita para surtir las demandas que se han incrementado últimamente, ella cofia en la bondad de las personas para ayudar a quienes más lo necesitan, y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Rocio is married and lives in Apodaca, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. Twelve years ago, he husband became unemployed and it was very difficult for him to find other work. To help her husband through these hard times, Rocio decided to start her own business selling chemical products and became a hair stylist. Now her business has grown, and she sells a greater number of products and has taken courses on coloring, cutting and tattooing.

To keep her business growing, Rocio is requesting a loan of $250, which she will use to purchase supplies to offer her clients a wider selection and meet their demands. She plans to repay the loan within three to six months. You can play a fundamental role in the growth of this business, and Rocio is grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rocio es casada y vive en L. localidad D. Apodaca, en el estado D. Nuevo León. Hace 12 años su esposo quedó desempleado y le fue muy difícil encontrar otro empleo, para ayudar a su esposo en estos momentos difíciles Rocio decidió iniciar su propio negocio con L. venta D. productos químicos y desempeñar su oficio D. estilista, ahora su negocio ha crecido, cuenta con un mayor número D. productos y ha tomado cursos D. actualización en tintes, cortes y tatuajes.

Para continuar creciendo, Rocio solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que destinará a L. compra D. mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y poder suplir su demanda, elL. devolverá esta cantidad en un lapso D. 3 a 6 meses. Atrévete a formar parte fundamental en el crecimiento D. este negocio, Rocio agradece mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
My name is Bertha P.. I am an entrepreneur and I own a small convenience store (cosmetics, decoration, fabrics, and kitchen and living room furniture), with the name "Variedades Bertha". I have been in business for several years. I have a good clientèle and experience with my business. It generates the income necessary to pay for the family expenses and other obligations with my providers. Thanks to this business, I have been able to provide for my children, because I am a single mother. From my income, I am renting a floor and my greatest wish is to build my own home.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Mi nombre es Bertha P., mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de Variedades(Cosmeticos, adornos, telas y muebles de sala y cocina ), llamado variedades " BERTHA" tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, cuento con buena clientela y experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos, ya que soy madre soltera y de las utilidades estoy pagando un solar y mayor deseo es construir mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy porcelain decorations, lotions, cosmetics, fabrics, and living room and kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Dashgin

texts.en: Dashgin is a young 24-year-old resident of Saatli town. He is not married yet. His main business is butchery. He also breeds cattle in his family house. He sells livestock and also slaughters cattle in his butchery. He has been in this business since 2002 and has made a considerable contribution in his family income. He wants to develop his cattle breeding, increase the number of livestock and increase his income. He has applied to borrow $500 to buy two calves. His father is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Malelega

texts.en: Malelega is an active lady of twenty five years of age with two kids now. She applies for a $300USD loan which will be used to buy all the ingredients needed for her business. She sells her pancakes with the coffee at the market mostly in the morning time where most of the workers are there for their morning tea. She earns 180 Tala ($72 US) profit per day and works five days per week. She hopes that her next loan will be used to open her new fast foods stall business at the flea market where she plans to cater foods to the public who are on their way around town. She likes the loan program and hopes to stay long in it.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pancakes/coffee business

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en: Raghida lives in the region of Aley in Lebanon. She has three children and is working to support her family. Raghida sells plastic containers used for food preservation. She needs a loan of $700 in order to buy the needed merchandise for her business. Raghida is determined to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy the needed merchandise for her business

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
The lady Frida lives in her own home on Ugarte street in the Tacagua zone of the City of La Paz with her husband and children. Her husband works in a business where they pay very little, so she works making caps and she will create costumes for the Carnival. The loan that she requests is for purchase of fabric and other materials for the making of costumes for the festivals of Carnival that are in next month of February.

From her credit history, one can agree to a new loan, since her previous repayment went very well. She and their husband have been our clients since the year 2006.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Frida vive en casa propia en la calle Ugarte de la zona de Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos; el esposo trabaja en una empresa donde le pagan muy poco por lo cual ella se dedica a costura de gorras y por las fecha de carnaval confeccionará disfraces. El crédito que solicita es para compra de tela y otros materiales para la confección de disfraces para las fiestas de Carnaval que son el próximo mes de Febrero.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que pago muy bien. Ella y su esposo son clientes nuestros desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread and other supplies to make costumes.

loans.name: Osariere

texts.en: Osariere O. is 27 years old and married with 2 children. He and his family  live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells fresh tomatoes to market vendors for a living. He is requesting a $1200 loan to enable him buy more fresh tomatoes for sale. He has been in this business for 3 years is also a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Rejoice's Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Rejoice E..  she is currently in the business of beer and local breweries and is requesting a loan to invest capital. Rejoice is 29 years old and she is married with a husband who is a peasant .she has 3 children ranging from age 2 to 11 and her children go to school. each week, Rejoice makes approximately 280 sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open a deport .Rejoice is joined in her small group by Margaret A., Mary G., Tamara K., and Grace A..  Margaret A. has a business in bread and vegetable selling and wants to expand her business. Mary G. is currently operating a business in bread selling and wants a loan to expand her business.Tamara K. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand the business.  Grace A. is currently in the business of selling beans and sugar and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: capital investment

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
Nhoem K. B., 33, is a widow and lives with her two children. She works at a karaoke parlor, where she has been playing songs for the customers for over 5 years. Including her tips, she earns around $8 a day. Her children are students.

When she was young, she learned how to do make up and she used to be on staff at hair dresser shop, so she knows how to be a hair dresser. To generate an extra income, she decided to take a loan from Kiva to purchase powder and some hairdressing equipment to serve the people around her house when she is not working at the karaoke bar.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah O. is a woman who has determination to expand her business. She is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. She has been in the business of selling local gin and kerosene for 10 years. Sarah lives in Benin City, but she goes to the village market to purchase the local gin, which she transports down to Benin City for sale to her customers. Sarah needs a loan of $450 to buy more local gin and kerosene for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more local gin and kerosene

loans.name: Von Bu Group

texts.en:
Mr. Von B. is the group leader of four in Ka Art village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a teacher in state school. Her husband, Mrs. Sokunthea Hem, is employed in a garment factory.

Together, they try to generate money to support the family but the family is still living in poor condition. Even the house is too old so Mr. Von B. now wants to build a new house. Unfortunately, he has insufficient money to build it. Thus, Mr. Von B. decided to ask for a loan to add with his profit to build it to replace an old one.

loans.use: To build a new house to replace an old one.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mey S., 47, is a widowed farmer who sells vegetables that she grows behind her house. She has been farming for eighteen years and makes about $3 per day. She lives with four children in Dang Kea Village, Pursat Province. One of her daughters works for a garment factory in Phnom Penh City and her income helps Mrs. S. with the family’s expenses. Mrs. S. now asks for a loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop and to purchase a pig to raise.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop and to purchase a pig to raise

loans.name: Gomis

texts.fr:
Gomis P. is a 36-year-old widow with 5 children in her care, for whom she would like to provide good living and health conditions. She would like to buy palm oil, lemon juice, and brooms to resell them. This loan will allow her to grow her small business. She plans to repay this loan after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Gomis P. est une femme de 36 ans, veuve avec 05 enfants en charge et elle souhaiterait leur assurer une bonne condition de vie et de santé. Elle souhaite acheter de l’huile de palme, du jus de citron et des balais afin de les revendre. Ce prêt lui permettra ainsi de fructifier ce petit commerce dans lequel elle s’active. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: to grow her business of selling palm oil, lemon juice, and brooms

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Холматов Хабибулло, 1971 года рождения, женат и имеет 3 детей.  Он торгует продуктами питания. У него 15 лет опыта в этой сфере. Ассортимент продаваемого товара состоит из кондитерских изделий, разновидностей консервной продукции, продуктов детского питания, разных сливочных и хлопковых масел, сахара, хлеба, колбасных изделий и т.д. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе. Его магазин находится в центре кишлака, и многие жители покупают необходимые продукты у него.  
Хабибулло хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для оптового закупа муки, риса, сахара и растительного масла.
texts.en:
Habibullo H. was born in 1971. He is married and has three children. He trades in foodstuffs. He has fifteen years of experience. His inventory consists of confections, supplies for canning, children's food, butter and cottonseed oil, sugar, bread, sausage, etc. He buys the goods in a wholesale shop called Safar-Center in Dushanbe. His shop is in the village center, and many people buy their necessities there. Habibullo wants to take out a loan for 4,100 somoni to buy flour, rice, sugar and vegetable oil wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour, rice, sugar, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy Idunmwonyi is 32 years old and is married with a child. She sells foodstuffs and fruits like pears and oranges. The demand for her fruits and foodstuffs is high and she would like to retain her customers by meeting their demands. She requests a loan amount of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and fruits to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kreal

texts.en:
Mr. Kreal K. is a villager in Preak Russey village in Kandal province.  He is a fisherman and his wife, Mrs. Nao Roeurn, is a farmer.  In her farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have animals to plow the rice field.  So, her husband decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. 

Mr. Kreal K. is 35 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only two years old.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field, and purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing clothing in bulk

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thi D. 51 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 1 con đã trưởng thành và đã đi làm. Hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi  chị D. còn tranh thủ thời gian  đan thúng bán nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện tại với thu nhập  3.000.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi, đan thúng và lương thợ xây của chồng kinh tế gia đình chị D. đang ngày càng ổn dịnh và phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị D. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng mua nguyên liệu về đan thúng, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi D. is 51 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 2005. She has three children, one of whom is grown and is working. Besides raising livestock, Mrs. Pham also weaves basket to increase her family's income. Currently, with an income of 3,000,000 VND per month from raising livestock, weaving baskets and from her husband's salary as a construction worker, her family's economy is becoming stable and growing. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to party invest in materials for weaving baskets and to invest in raising livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Nasreen Akbar Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen. I am 42 years old and married. I live in a city of kind hearted people named Borewala, Pakistan. I have lived here for the past eight years. My husband's name is A. A.. He runs a juice corner in the food market.

I am a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of my kids are getting education from a school which is located near my house. I am involved in an embroidery business. I make embroidered dresses to order and charge $3 per dress. I do this work to pay off the school fees for my children.

I am applying for a loan to buy another juice machine and seasonal fruits, so that my husband can earn a good income and attracts more customers.

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another juice machine and seasonal fruits for juice corner

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles O. tiene 56 años, está casada, y no tiene hijos. Doña María es costurera y hace más de cuarenta años que tiene de poseer este negocio. Con el fin de obtener ingresos, decidió comercializar sus productos en los mercados. El lugar en donde se ubica su negocio está en su casa de habitación, por lo que sus clientes le realizan los encargos de prendas de vestir. Cuando inició este negocio, dio inicio con una pequeña máquina de coser, elaborando sencillas prendas de vestir como faldas y trajes para dama. Es así como su negocio logró a crecer. El financiamiento que necesita es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir. Sus sueños son de tener una fábrica de costura en la que pueda emplear a muchas personas que realmente quieren trabajar. El monto que solicita es de C$ 21.000 córdobas a un plazo de 10 meses.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles O. is 56 years old, married, and does not have children. María is a seamstress, and has had this business for more than forty years. With the goal of generating income, she decided to sell her products at the markets. Her business is located in her own home, where her customers realize their clothing orders. She started out with just one small sewing machine, making simple garments such as skirts and women’s suits. This is how she managed to grow her business. The financing she needs is to buy raw materials for making her clothes. Her dream is to have her own tailor shop, where she could employ a lot of people who truly want to work. The amount she is requesting is 21,000 Nicaraguan, over a term of 10 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Hermelinda es casada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Hermelinda tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. carne, los animales los adquiere en las ferias D. la región y luego los beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad.
Hermelinda necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno.
Hermelinda sueña con ahorrar para construir el segundo piso D. su casa, tener capital propio e implementar su puesto con una maquina cortadora.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in Quecha. Hermelinda is married, 60 years old, and has seven children. She has a stand in the F. Vivanco market where she sells meat. She buys the animals at regional fairs and later brings them to the city slaughterhouse. Hermelinda needs a loan of $925 to purchase cattle. Hermelinda dreams of saving up to build a second floor on her house, to have her own capital and supply her stand with a meat cutting machine.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina O. is married and has three children.  She has received schooling through junior high.  Faustina has sold fried yams and turkey tails at Abura, since 2001.  Her husband is a trader.  Faustina uses her income to assist her husband in house keeping expenses.  Faustina will use the loan as additional capital to increase her sales of fried yams and turkey tails to meet the increase in demand from her customers.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to save towards a house she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Increase the sale of fried yams and turkey tails to meet the increase in demand from customers.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. She and her husband Ivan have two kids. Their family lives in Ordzhonikidze. Irina sells clothing items in the central marketplace of her home town as well as small village markets in her region. Irina’s opened her business 15 years ago. Currently, she has about 19,000 Hryvnia in working capital. Her profit amounts to 2,700 Hryvnia a month.

Irina is a hard worker. Clients always feel welcome when they come to buy from Irina because she gives each customer her full attention, and serves them politely and with respect. Reasonable pricing and a variety of inventory make her store appeal to many customers looking for a bargain. Irina realizes that lending services have helped her business grow and become self-sustainable. Irina is requesting a loan of 9,000 Hryvnia to increase her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of outfits that would be both durable and apealing to all of her customers. She believes that assortment of inventory at exceptionally reasonable prices will draw many new clients to her business.

loans.use: To expand merchandise

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 30-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region with his wife and their child. Fadi has been working as an electrician for 16 years. He has requested a loan of $2,300 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Fadi has requested a loan.

Fadi believes he is special in his business because of his many years of experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He started the business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Kelechi

texts.en: Kelechi is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She sells rechargeable phone cards and she also makes commercial calls. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
C. is 25 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than six years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen.

She is married to Run Sok, 29, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. Because of this reason, that is why C. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment for her husband

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie P. Jr. is a 35-year-old bachelor in Banga, South Cotabato who has been engaged in his farming business for ten years now. He uses a part of his income for his daily needs and he saves some for his future family. And to be more prepared for his married life, he wants to expand his present business, which made him decide to apply for a Php 10,000 loan in the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He chooses to loan at CEVI because of its wide services to people and to have additional finances and savings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Neema L. from Mbeya. She is single with one child, 1 year old. Neema has been running a rice business since 2007. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Neema currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice. In the future, she plans to increase the size and range of her business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA CONCEPCION C. I. cuenta con una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "Mary" esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danlí,  tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta tipo de actividad el cual durante todo este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar muy bien, y con ello poco a poco ha sabido ganar la clientela por lo buen surtido que luce su negocio. 
La Sra. Concepcion es madre soltera, y su negocio que le permite generar mayores ingresos para poder mantener su hogar, ella desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida, nos comento que su sueño es tener un mercadito grande en el cual tenga todo tipo de productos para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria has a small grocery store that operates under the name “Pulperia Mary”. It is located in her house in the Pueblo Nuevo community in the city of Danlí. She has been working as a storekeeper for three years. During this time she has obtained the knowledge of running a profitable business. Little by little she has been gaining more customers because of the good assortment of products they see in her store. Mrs. Maria is a single mother and her business helps her generate the income necessary to support her home. She would like to improve her life. She told us that her dream is to have a larger market in which she would have all types of products to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy soft drinks, milk products, pastas, sugar, beans, tortillas, rice, wheat and corn flour, cookies, candy, lard, oil, salt, spices, canned juice, toilet paper and eggs.

loans.name: Vân

texts.en: Vân Thị T. (no. 010103040031) was born in 1980. She lives in Dong Dau, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her parents-in-law, her husband and their child. Her husband is a worker and Vân Thị T. is a farmer. She also raises geese and ducks. Her family has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She is requesting 5,014,000 VND to buy duck food.

loans.use: To purchase duck food

loans.name: Devotha

texts.en:
Devotha is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 22 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.her child is aged 2 years.

Devotha started her own shop business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 210,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Devotha`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 210,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Devotha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  clothes

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es: El señor Pablo Enrique C. Hernández , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio , los ríos , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa particular , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos de catorce y diez años , actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Pablo se siente contento con el apoyo que le hemos brindado ya que con el primer crédito tuvo resultados muy positivos , hasta pago antes del tiempo determinado , a la vez compro parte de materiales para su vivienda , con este segundo desembolso va a inducir mas los cultivos junto con la accesoria del técnico para establecer una parte mas de piña . Agradece ala institución por su buena aprobación con el financiamiento ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician con estos préstamos y que solo mediante este medio se puede prosperar debido a la crisis económica.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo Enrique C. Hernández is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Rios. Together with his wife, who works as a housekeeper at a private residence, they provide for the household expenses and support their two school-aged children (ages 14 and 10). They plan to improve the living conditions for their family.

Don Pablo is very happy with the support we provided through his first loan. The results were positive and he was able to repay ahead of schedule. The previous loan was used to buy materials for his house.

With this second loan, he hopes to increase his crop output by hiring a technician to help him set aside part of his land for growing pineapple. He thanks the Institution for approving his financing. Don Pablo believes many families could benefit from these loans as a means of helping them prosper in an economic crisis.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed & pay for technical support for growing pineapples

loans.name: Señor De La Picota Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor de la Picota inicia su  tercer ciclo con 16 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de leña, comidas, abarrotes en general, quesos, artesanías, cereales, ropa y tejido de chompas.
Como es el caso de Lucy que es soltera, tiene 53 años y 6 hijos, Lucy realiza servicios de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos, además teje chompas a mano, de acuerdo a los pedidos.
Mientras que Candelaria es viuda, tiene 70 años y 7 hijos, Candelaria vende quesos y chicharrón que compra en las ferias y lo en la ciudad de Lima de casa en casa, además teje chompas a pedido.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 600 soles, 750 soles, 900 soles haciendo un total de 12000 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de lana, quesos, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, carne, leña y artesanías.
Los sueños de las socias son ser empresarias, tener casa propia, mejorar sus negocios, tener una asociación de tejedoras y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de lana, quesos, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, carne, leña y artesanías.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen sells dried fish. She purchases fresh fish from the market and dries it at home to sell. She is 39 years old and married with four children.

Helen is hoping for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more fresh fish to dry and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to be dried for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old and married with three children. For the last six years, she has sold material and ready-made clothes near Nairobi’s town center in Gikomba. She is requesting a loan for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her inventory.

She describes herself as hardworking and says that since she joined Faulu, her business has expanded from a small retail store to a large-scale business. She added that she has also learned to save. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living and own her own business premises.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of fabric and clothes

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: D. Geneviève est née le 14 Mai 1977 à Athiémé à proximité de la frontière du Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Geneviève est mariée à AMEGNIKOU Daniel, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Geneviève vit depuis huit ans avec son conjoint et ses enfants au quartier Hèdomey à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Geneviève vient en aide à son mari Daniel dans les charges de la famille. Geneviève n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a quatre ans de cela que Geneviève vend de la liqueur locale (communément appelée « sodabi ») et aussi de la nourriture (haricot) dans sa baraque à son domicile. Geneviève fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Adja dans le Mono au Bénin. Geneviève a déjà obtenu de ALIDé un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. En vue d’augmenter la taille de son activité et de vendre davantage ses produits, Geneviève sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Geneviève was born on May 14, 1977 in Athiémé, near the border of Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is married to AMEGNIKOU Daniel, a chauffeur.  The couple has four children, some of whom are in school.  For eight years, Geneviève has been living with her husband and children in the Hèdomey district in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. She comes to her husband Daniel's aid to meet family expenses.  Geneviève has never been to school.  For four years, she has been selling a local liquor (commonly called sodabi) and also food (beans) in her stall at her home.  She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also from Adja in Mono, in Benin.  She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid.  With the aim of expanding her business and selling more goods, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 drums of local liquor, 3 sacks of beans, and 3 drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Liezell

texts.en:
Liezell R. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Liezell is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Liezell owns & operates a business venture in motorcycle transport. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Liezell has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 150 Php daily for these activities.

In 2009, Liezell joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in another business activities. Due to lack of financial assistance for the education of her children, Liezell is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase some vegetables to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Liezell from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase some vegetables to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Alejandra

texts.es: Guadalupe Alejandra B. H. de 21 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de pericos australianos, conejos y así mismo vende productos como alimento y accesorios para mascotas. A pesar que el negocio es pequeño, Guadalupe agradece mucho poder contar con el debido que es a través de este como puede ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de su  bebé. Guadalupe solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos como alimento, platos y productos para el cuidado de los animales. Esto lo hace con la ilusión de poder aumentar sus ventas y así su economía familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Alejandra B. H. is 21 years old, and lives in Soyapango with her husband and her two-year-old son. She sells Australian parakeets, rabbits, and other products such as food and accessories. Even though her business is small, she is grateful for the income, for it allows her to help her husband and child with household expenses. Guadalupe is asking for a loan to buy items such as food, dishes, and accessories to care for animals. Her vision is to increase sales and thus income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for animal care

loans.name: Gavaa

texts.en: Gavaa U. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 11-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, one of Mongolia's southwestern provinces. His daughter is 11 years old and goes to a local secondary school. Gavaa has a small business in wood chopping. He used to work at a local bath house as a mechanist. When he was a mechanist, he chopped wood at home and sold to locals. Since 2006, he left his job to expand his wood chopping business, which was more lucrative than his bath house job. Since the start in 2006, he has already gained some frequent customers who always purchase chopped wood from him. He says that he would like to expand his business by opening a small marketplace where he would be able to sell chopped woods in wholesale in large amounts. He requests a loan to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio O. M., tiene la edad de 50 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 28,16,15 y 14 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la una granja de gallinas y para arreglar la porqueriza de los cerdos y comprar dos cerdos más. Con esta inversión el espera poder aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su situación económica. Es la segunda vez que don Eusebio se financia con FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. 
El espera que con este proyecto pueda crecer y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Eusebio O. M. is 50 years old and has four children who are his highest priority. His children are 28, 16, 15, and 14 years old respectively. The loan he is requesting will be used for his chicken farm and also to remodel his pig sty and buy two more pigs. With this investment, he hopes to increase his earnings so that he can improve his financial situation. This is the second time Eusebio has received a loan from FUDECOSUR. The loan committee has been a great help and offers different options when applying for a loan.

Eusebio hopes this new project will grow and that in the future he can provide his children with a better quality of life and financial stability.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel his pig sty, purchase two pigs, and invest in his chicken farm

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer está formado en la comunidad de Zhidmad a unos 40 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca,  en esta localidad podemos apreciar  la belleza de su paisaje andino durante todo el viaje, la mayor parte de su gente  se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales siendo esta actividad el  sustento para sus familias.

 La señora Blanca R. es socia activa de éste banco hace diez años motivada por Rosa R., Blanca tiene 37 años y vive junto a sus tres hijos de 18, 15 y 2 años de edad en la comunidad de Zhimad pues su esposo  migró fuera del país en busca de  bienestar y  mayor comodidad para su familia  consiguiendo construir su casa propia a base de sacrificio y esfuerzo conjunto.

Blanca al igual que la mayoría de sus compañeras del banco se dedica a la cría de pollos  hace seis  años, solo ha llegado a tener 100 porque tiene que comprar mucho alimento y a veces no le alcanza el dinero, pero también se dedica  a la elaboración de guaipe que entrega  a sus clientes fijos o en algunas ferreterías recorriendo toda la ciudad  lleva un año en esta otra actividad.

Con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar alimento para sus pollos como  chanca,  balanceado y maíz,  su  meta es seguir incrementando su negocio de pollos.

De igual manera  Zoila R. lleva  tres años  trabajando en su banco comunal gracias al presidente de la Junta Parroquial,  ella tiene 38 años y vive en su casa propia esfuerzo conyugal  con su esposo de oficio albañil y sus cuatro hijos de 19, 16,15 y 6 años.

Ella realiza guaipe  lleva 9 años trabajando gracias a  un familiar que le enseñó como elaborarlo,  para ello recibe la tela de una fabrica pero solo pueden ser beneficiarias si tienen un carnet de identificación que la institución  les hace entrega, luego de elaborar el guaipe vende por diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca o a sus clientes fijos que le hacen pedidos con frecuencia

Con el préstamo que reciba va a comprar tela  para elaborar más guaipe y buscar nuevos clientes. Su meta es  llegar a ser una gran comerciante de guaipe.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) Communal Bank is located in the community of Zhimad, some 40 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. In this locality you can really appreciate the beauty of the Andean countryside. The greater part of the population is dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising, which is the activity that sustains their families. Mrs. Blanca R. has been an active member of this bank for 10 years, motivated by Rosa R.. Blanca is 37 years old and lives with her 3 children, aged 18, 15, and 2, in Zhimad, since her husband migrated out of the country in search of wellbeing and greater comfort for his family. They succeeded in building their own house with sacrifice and effort in common. Blanca, like the majority of her fellow bank members, raises chickens and has done so for 6 years. She has only acquired 100 because she has to buy so much feed and at times, there isn't enough money. She also makes dust cloths which she provides to fixed customers, or sells in some hardware stores spread around the entire city. She has been doing this for the past year. With this new loan, she will buy chicken feed and corn for the chickens. Her goal is to continue to expand her chicken business. In like manner, Zoila R. has been working with her communal bank for 3 years, thanks to the president of her Parroquial Committee. She is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, a brick layer, and their 4 children, ages 19, 16, 15, and 6. She has been making dust cloths for 9 years, thanks to a family member who taught her how to make them. For this, she receives cloth from a factory. To benefit, she has to have an identity card provided by the company. After making the dust cloths, she sells them in different parts of Cuenca, or to her set customers who request them frequently. With this loan she will buy cloth to make dust cloths in hopes of locating new customers. He goal is to become a major merchant of dust cloths.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CHICKEN FEED & CORN FOR CHICKENS, AND CLOTH FOR MAKING DUST CLOTHS TO SELL

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana Dolores M. R. tiene 25 años, es casada y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos que se llaman Jessica Alexandra, Myra Enes, y Henry Joel.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura y tiene cultivos de mora, maiz, papas, y habas.  Hace las compras de las semillas y abonos de los distribuidores en Guaranda.  Vende la mora a los comerciantes en la comunidad misma y los otros cultivos en Guaranda.  Solicita el crédito para la mora para comprar abonos y remedios.

Su sueño es obtener terreno y que estudien sus hijos para que sean una profesion.
texts.en:
Ana Dolores M. R. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and three children: Jessica Alexandra, Myra Enes, and Henry Joel.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan”, which means “New Road” in Quechua. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All of them have a great desire to work with credit so that they can get ahead in life.

Ana is a farmer who grows blackberries, corn, potatoes, and lima beans. She purchases her seeds and organic fertilizers from the distributors in Guaranda. The blackberries she produces are sold to merchants in her community, while her other crops are sold in Guaranda. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy compost and remedies for her blackberry crop.

Among her dreams are to obtain land and see her children pursue an education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & remedies for her blackberry crop

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio B. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa en ocasiones le ayuda a preparar los dulces.

Desde muy pequeño sus padres lo llevaban a vender caramelos en las calles de Guayaquil, debido a la falta de oportunidades y los pocos ingresos que tenía con familia. Continuó como vendedor abundante de dulces, pero ahora el mismo los prepara.  

Ahora el trabaja los martes hasta los domingos, vendiendo cocos en fundas, panela, cocadas en las calles de Guayaquil. Su trabajo lo realiza en los buses les vende a los pasajeros los dulces que el mismo elabora. Las lluvias le han sido de dificultad en las ventas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar coco, panela, maní para tener más variedad en las ventas. En el futuro quiere tener en su casa su negocio y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Silvio B. is 38, and he lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. His house is concrete, and he only has the basic services of electricity and water. At times his wife helps him prepare the sweets. Since he was very small his parents took him to sell candy on the streets of Guayaquil. They did this because of the lack of opportunities and the small amount of income the family had. He continued as a street vendor selling sweets, except now he makes them himself. Now he works from Tuesdays through Sundays. He sells bags of coconut, “panela” (an unrefined food product, which is basically a solid piece of sucrose and fructose), and “cocadas” (sweetened meat candy) on the streets of Guayaquil. He works on the busses and sells the sweets he made to the passengers. The rains have made sales difficult. With the loan he wants to buy coconut, panela, and peanuts to have a greater variety in his sales. In the future he wants to have a business in his house and be able to better construct his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coconut, "panela" (solid piece of sugar), and peanuts

loans.name: Ebenezer #4 Group

texts.en:
Martin M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ebenezer #4.  He sells office supplies such as pens, pencils, paper, files, and calculators, and intends to use his portion of this 29,400 LRD group loan to buy more stock for his business.  

Martin is a 26-year-old high school graduate who is unmarried and has two children ages two and three who attend nursery school.  Martin sells from a table on Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia's capital.  He has had his business for more than five years, and says when he started out he sold flowers and cards, but moved to office supplies instead.

Martin says that sometimes he has problems with customers -- their manner of approach is not good.  The street which he sells from is often crowded and hectic.  He hopes one day to grow his business enough to open a proper shop.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martin is the one holding the sign.  Jubi G. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy more office supplies for resale.

loans.name: America

texts.en:
America is 35 years old, married, and has two children ages eight and nine months. She is a member of the “Unidos para el Truinfo” (United for Triumph) community bank. America makes a living selling candles. These include “cirios”, which are large candles normally used in street processions for local saints in the Catholic religion here in Cuzco. She has owned this business for seven years, but says that business is somewhat slow right now. 

America is hoping that business will pick up with the help of a loan in the coming months, and says she will use the Kiva loan to sustain and improve her candle business. Specifically, she will buy wax to make the candles with the Kiva loan money. America is appreciative of and grateful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Wax to make candles

loans.name: Gomez

texts.en: Gomez Ma. C. is from the town of Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Gomez owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 27,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Gomez joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gomez is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 10th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita E. is from the village of Olango. She is 49 years old. Rosita is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Rosita E. Group'.

Rosita is widowed and has 8 children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a butcher shop. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita S. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Rosita is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Rosita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Hayanhyarvaa

texts.en: Hayanhyarvaa B. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a public transport service between the two biggest markets, Harhorin and Narantuul, since 1999. He purchased another microbus via leasing in 2004 and uses his two buses for his transportation business. Hayanhyarvaa's wife helps him by working as a conductress. Hayanhyarvaa works very hard and is a silent, modest person. He says, “My only wish is to save the advance payment to purchase a recently imported micro bus via leasing”. He is requesting a 1,000,000MNT loan to purchase some construction materials to build a garage for his new buses.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been farming for the last 10 years on the outskirts of Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been producing milk, maize, beans and pineapples, all of which she sells to the local market. Her primary challenge in farming has been lack of enough animal feed that affects her milk production, and lack of reliable casual labourers. She is also employed and earns extra income from her retail shop and rental houses in the same area.

Esther is 50 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 11 and 19. All her children are attending school.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will improve the standard of living of the family since there will be more disposable income from the sale of milk. In future, she would like to increase the size of her land and plant more dairy feed. She also plans to increase her rental houses and the number of her dairy cows. 

Esther is part of a 5 person solidarity group -- when one receives a loan, the others guarantee it.  As it is her rotation, this loan is for Esther's business alone.  She says, however, that group lending is sometimes discouraging because not all members are reliable. She hopes Juhudi will consider giving loans without requiring solidarity groups in future."

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a disassembled tractor.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Señora Alejandra L. es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayuda mucho a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, tiene dos hijos pequeños y ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde corta pelo. Requieren este crédito ya que quiere cambiar la puerta de entrada de el lugar en donde la tiene actualmente, ya que la puerta esta en el lugar en donde quiere construir un cuarto para ahí colocar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra L. is hardworking and entrepreneurial. Her husband helps her a lot with household expenses. They have 2 young children and Alejandra runs a small hair salon in her home. She needs this loan for construction. Alejandra plans to remove the front door and build an additional room where she can relocate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change the front door.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila Y. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 53 years old. Mila is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Mila is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Mila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a housewife and mother from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She has four sons and one daughter.

Ghada’s husband, Hamed, is a Palestinian National Authority employee and a taxi driver. The salary he receives forced him to find another job to be able to raise the five children he has, especially with the hard living conditions in Gaza Strip. The taxi business is helping the family to cover their expenses and live a better life.

Ghada is a loyal client of FATEN, having taken three previous loans. She is taking a $3,000 loan from FATEN as her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi as it's been in service for seven years now and needs a few modifications and more frequent maintenance.

in the photo, Ghada's oldest son, Shadi, stands next to the taxi.

loans.use: To enable her husband to perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man and father of two young children. He lives in Lebanon. He has over ten years of experience working with car spare parts. He has owned his own business since 2003. With his requested loan  of US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will invest in increasing his inventory and therefore increase his sales. 

In the future, he is planning to open a bigger store to trade and sell spare parts and deliver his business to other areas. He told us that he would like to one day open a commercial center.

loans.use: increasing his inventory

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es: La Sra. Senobia  vive en el municipio de el Torno, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra, es nacida en el mismo municipio, se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales extraído de la naturaleza, su es poso con el que vive hace ya treinta años y tienen cuatro hijo de los cuales dos están a su cargo, también se dedica a este negocio el cual le a resultado rentable, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir su domicilio que se encuentra en obra rustica, necesitan compra material de construcción como cemento, pintura, etc. La Sra. Esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Senobia lives in the municipality of Torno in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She was born there and works selling natural medicinal extracts. Her husband of thirty years also works in this business, which has proved to be profitable. They have four children, two of which are still under their care. This loan will be used to finish building their house which is currently built of simple, rustic materials. They need to buy construction materials like cement, paint, etc. Mrs. Senobia is very thankful for the support being offered her.

loans.use: To do construction on her house

loans.name: Meyling Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Meyling del Socorro V. H.  ella es Trabajadora activa del colegio público  de San Pablo desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Secundaria tiene cuatro años de trabajar en esta institución, es casada actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra  de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Meyling del Socorro V. H. works for the public school in San Pablo as a secondary school teacher.  She has been working for this institution for four years, she is married, and has two school-age children.  
She has had two loans with CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase construction materials to improve her home.  The loans from CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her and have allowed her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.
