The group has learned from past mistakes: one year, they lost a considerable amount of crop due to drought, and now diversify by planting a larger variety of drought resistance seeds.  The members of El Progreso would like their children to have the opportunity to work outsiD. of farming, as it is quite difficult work.  They all hope that through their efforts and with the help of loans, they can create a better future for their children.

loans.use: Cultivating land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 45 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. Currently all the children are in school. She loves selling goods as a source of livelihood.  She has been selling cereals like maize, gari, the sale of palm oil etc. for three years now. She treks to farming communities like Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her stock of cereals in bulk from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and retail to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy bulk supply of cereals to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Yiedeai’ which means Wealth.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy more cereals like maize, gari and palm oil etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is already 45 years old. Her husband Ramon is working as a driver in a rice mill in their village. They are blessed with five children: Romel - 25 years old; Arcelie - 23 years old; Ramon Jr. - 17 years old; Monette - 15 years old, high school student, and Maria Angelica - 1 year old. They are living harmoniously at Barangay Centro 2, Angadanan, Isabela.

Nenita has been engaged in a fish-vending business for almost a year in their village. Through her business, she was able to help her husband in providing the needs of their family. Nenita is doing her best to improve her vending business to support the education of their two children who are still in school.

She is now hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 8,000 as business capital. This will assist her in maintaining her enterprise.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Fatoumata Binetou

texts.fr: FATOUMATA EST UNE JEUNE FEMME NEE LE 25 MARS 1972 A THIES .ELLE EST MARIEE A UN GENDARME ET EST MERE DE DEUX ENFANTS.ELLE FAIT DU COMMERCE DEPUIS PRESQUE QUINZE ANS .SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A VENDRE DES TISSUS,des chaussures ,des sacs ,du thé et des articles divers;elle dispose d'une clientèle importante. Avec ce pret ,elle envisage de renforcer son activité pour satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is a young woman who was born on March 25, 1972 in Thies. She is married to a gendarme and is the mother of 2 children. She has been a petty trader for almost 15 years. Her business consists in selling cloth, shoes, handbags, tea, and various other items. She has quite a sizeable clientele. With this loan, she intends to bolster her business to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering her little business

loans.name: Riskat

texts.en: Riskat is 39 years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors to her customers.  She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita C. is a widow. She lives with her three children at Barangay Lamo in Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. With her desire to give her children a better future, she sacrifices her time to earn a living to send them to school. She is thankful because her children help her earn income on weekends and vacation days. She manages a direct selling business. She is a dealer of AVON products in her village.

Julita also sells native cakes in the market and sometimes roams around the village to sell her products. She earns PHP1,000 and she used her income for the school allowance of her children. Julita decided to borrow a loan of PHP10, 000 for her direct selling and vending businesses, to increase her daily income.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her shop

loans.name: María Celestina

texts.es: Doña María Celestina T. C.  es viuda cuenta con 33 años de edad vive con una hija lleva cinco años laborando como costurera  y cuenta con un pequeño local en su comunidad por circunstancias de la vida se encuentra sola sobresaliendo cada día para poder sostener a su pequeña hija, por tal razón se acercó a la asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar una estufa comercial y así facilitar un servicio a la comunidad aledañas vendiendo tortillas alimenticias de maíz, actualmente la demanda a la actividad a la que se dedica, sus ingresos son muy bajos, por las circunstancias ella necesita otro fuente de ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida que  tiene y así poder salir adelante y poder sufragar sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Doña María Celestina T. C. is a 33 year old widow and has a 5 year old daughter. She is a seamstress and operates a small workshop in her community. The circumstances of life have left her standing alone to support her young daughter.

For this reason, she has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan for a commercial oven for making nutritious corn tortillas that she can sell in the neighboring communities. There is a great demand for tortillas, but she doesn’t earn enough money to get started. Given her circumstances, she needs another source of income to improve her living conditions. This will help her get ahead and enable her to cover her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an oven to start a second business selling tortillas

loans.name: Koer

texts.en:
Mrs. T. and her husband have been married for years and have five children, all of whom are single except one who is married and lives away.

With traditional fishing nets, Mrs. T. and her husband, Mathly, spend most of their time during the early morning and late afternoon of the day along the Mekong riverside. Sometimes, Mathly spreads the net into the water using his hands and the power of his shoulders and drags it up a few minutes later. Sometimes, T. rows the boat while he pulls from the water the net which he has prepared for almost half a day.

The family now faces difficulty with its fishing operation. So in order to fix the problem, T. and Mathly decided to look for a loan of $600 to buy an engine and fishing materials for their fishing business.

loans.use: To buy an engine and fishing materials for their fishing business

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden A., a 37-year-old woman, is married to a primary teacher and has five children. She lives in Gudele town, west of Juba city, near Upendo University. Kiden sells various items in her shop near her home such as: soaps, sweets (candies), earrings, necklaces, and many other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase and stock more items to sell in her shop. With the extra profits from her loan, Kiden aims to build a drug shop at the market and to stock drugs to sell. She will need also to buy a motorbike for the easy transportation of shop materials to the main shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma A. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old and married with 2 adult children. To make a living, Thelma sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has run her shop for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Thelma recently joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.She requesting a 5000 PHP loan to purchase more seafood products for her store.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase more seafood products for her store.

loans.name: Rang

texts.en: An small-sized wooden house in Siem Reap is the location of Mrs. K.'s home and grocery store. She usually buys produce in bulk from a marker supplier and sells it from her house. Normally, she can make average income of $3.00 per day. She has been running her business since early 2007. Her husband, Chomreun, age 23, helps her with the business, and who appears in the picture. This youngest couple is newly married with no child. K.'s investment is main source of income for the family and she recently sold all of the produce in her store. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José F. nasceu na cidade de Tete, Província de mesmo nome no centro de Moçambique, tem 56 anos de idade, casado e pai de 1 filho de 26 anos de idade. Fez 3ª classe e não foi possível continuar porque foi solicitado para cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família. Para além desta, sustenta também sua mãe que está em Tete enviando dinheiro mensalmente. 

Em 1974 saiu de Tete para Tanzânia como combatente, volta directamente para o quartel de Boane Província de Maputo e foi desmobilizado em 1995, convida a sua família para juntos residirem em Boane. Actualmente é desmobilizado e pensionista. Faz agricultura com a sua esposa e faz em media cerca de 10 a 11 horas de trabalho por dia, aprendeu esta actividade em Tanzânia quando foi incorporado como militar em 1975. 

Recebe uma pensão do Ministério da Defesa no valor de 2.900.00MT por mês e, com ajuda do rendimento da machamba, consegue sustentar a família e ainda poupar algum no Banco BARCLAYS.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho e amigos. Este é o seu 3º credito no valor de 12.000.00MT, com o qual pretende comprar chapas de zinco, ferro, cimento e outros. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 8.000.00MT e 10.300.00MT, ambos foram pagos sem problemas e para a mesma actividade. 

Neste empréstimo tem como objectivo, concluir a sua obra e melhorar as condições sanitárias. Pretende pedir mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e compra de mobiliário de casa.
texts.en:
José F. was born in Tete, in central Mozambique. He is 56, married and has a 26 year old son. He finished 3rd grade but had to drop school to join the army. He lives in his own house with his famliy. He also supports his mother in Tete, sending her money every month. In 1974, Jose left Tete to Tanzania with the army; he later came back to Boane and retired from the army in 1995. He gets a monthly pension of 2.900,00MT (U$ 100) per month from the military. He and his wife are farm workers and work between 10 and 11 hours every day. This is Jose's third loan in the amount of 12.000,00MT (U$425) which he'sll use to buy construction supplies (zinc, iron, cement, and others) in order to finish building his house and improve the sanitary conditions. He hopes to pay this loan without a problem so he can ask for another one in order to buy furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction supplies (sand, rock, cement, others)

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is married and has two children. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Belaya Tserkov town. Svetlana has been in this business for 5 years. She is a very lively, enthusiastic and hard working person. She has good knowledge of her products and provides great client service. She enjoys her sales business and wants to expand it more. This year, Svetlana gave birth to her second child and today her family needs extra income. Svetlana would like to borrow 15,000 UAH in order to purchase winter inventories. She hopes to increase her sales and to receive additional income for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase winter inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
el sr. Mario V. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Flores, se dedica al comercio, su negocio es compra y venta de muebles de hierro para salas, electrodomesticos como ser hornos electricos, tostadoras, planchas, batidoras, licuadoras etc.
ahorita Mario no tiene capital para invertir en comprar su producto ya que casi todo lo tiene vendido a varios clientes, pero como el trabaja al credito no logra reunir todo el dinero de un solo para comprar mas mercaderia por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas electrodomesticos y asi tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias en esta epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se vende.
se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio lo esta sacando adelante a el y a su familia que es lo mas importante que el tiene.
texts.en:
Mario V., 37, lives in the Las Flores neighborhood. He is a merchant who sells metal furniture and home appliances like electric ovens, toasters, irons, mixers, blenders, etc. Right now, Mario lacks funds to invest in inventory since just about everything is already sold to various customers. But, because he extends his items on credit, he is unable to gather enough funds all at once to buy more merchandise. For this reason, he is requesting financing to buy home appliances so that he can have better sales and higher profits, especially now during the Christmas selling season when sales are at their best. He is very happy because his business is allowing his family, who is the most important thing he owns, to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electric ovens, toasters, blenders, hair dryers, mixers and metal room dividers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Said Khan Agha

texts.en:
This is S. Khan Agha, son of Sayed Osman Badshah. At this time, his fields are not fertile and he wants to improve his field's crops. He lives in Kama district. He is 47 years old and married with six children: four sons and two daughters. One is a bachelor hardworking man with much experience. His youngest son has graduated from an agricultural university. The others are students at school.

When he was informed that a loan process is supporting the people, he came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 afghani to buy high quality seeds and to obtain good products to help solve his problems. He would like to thank both AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and Kiva lenders who support people around the world through this effective process.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Club B Candiru Jamira Group

texts.en:
C. Jamira is a hardworking business lady who is 28 years old and runs a drugstore. She is married and blessed with three children who are in school.

She has been operating the drugstore for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase medicines for the drugstore. Her business is improving and, moreover, allowing her to pay the school fees of her children. Her future plan is to purchase a plot of land and see her children through school.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for her drugstore

loans.name: Enrrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrrique R., tiene una propiedad de 12 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 4 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos(frijol y maíz), 2 manzanas sembradas de café y 6 manzanas de área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz, también a la caficultura,(cultivo de café) las cuales también cultivan y cosecha cada año  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como 4 quintales de abono, 8 quintales de urea y pago de  mano de obra para regulación de sombra. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 5 hijos quienes son mayores  de edad y le ayudaban en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos , actualmente sus 5 hijo ya están casados y son independientes de esta familia, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder llegar a producir más y mejor en sus áreas de cultivos, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos, produciendo y cosechando mas y de mejor calidad con el cultivo de café de esta forma el obtendrá una mejor comercialización de este rubro que es uno de los rubros de mayor importancia en los sectores de exportaciones de nuestro país, esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
Don Enrrique R., ha tenido 7 créditos  desde el año 2006 lleva 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Enrique R. has a property that is 12 Manzanas big (1 Manzana = 1.68 acres) and he uses different areas for different activities: he has 4 Manzanas to plant basic grains (beans and rice), 2 Manzanas have planted coffee, and 6 Manzanas are suitable for cattle. He focuses on planting basic grains for consumption such as beans and corn, but also coffee farming, which he plants and harvests every year; activities for which he will use the loan. He will buy agricultural supplies such as 4 Quintales of fertilizer (1 Quintal = 100 kilograms or about 220 lbs), 8 Quintales of urea (fertilizer used as a source of nitrogen), and to pay for manual labor to manage shade for his crops. He started growing basic grains only in the winter season, and he did the work with his family; he is married and has 5 children who are now adults but used to help him with the farm work to plant and harvest the grains. His 5 children are now married and are living on their own. He has been doing this line of work for a long time and he continues doing it now; with this loan, he hopes to improve his productivity to produce more and better crops, and increase his income at the same time. If he harvests and produces more and better quality coffee, he will be able to better market this product which is one of the most important exporting products in this country; this will allow him to improve his quality of life. Mr. Enrique R. has had 7 loans since 2006 and has worked with Ceprodel for 4 years. The impact and benefits he has received from the loans is very important since they have allowed him to improve his agricultural activities which have resulted in a continued improvement of his quality of life and income.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies: 8 quintales of urea, 4 quintales of fertilizer, and manual labor.

loans.name: Fátima Elizabeth

texts.es:
Muy satisfecha se encuentra la señora Fatima R. porque ha sido una dama muy esforzada y ha logrado finalizar sus estudios universitarios y actualmente iniciará a realizar un curso para finalizar su carrera profesional. 
El crédito que ella ha solicitado lo invertirá en el pago de dicho curso y también en el pago de la tramitación de su título universitario para llegar a ver cumplido su sueño de ser una gran profesional de éxito y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida en el municipio de Villanueva.
texts.en:
Señora Fatima R. is very satisfied because through her hard work she has succeeded in completing her university studies, and she is currently starting a course towards the completion of her professional credential. The loan she has requested will be used to pay for this course, as well as to pay for the processing of her university degree. This will be the fulfillment of her dream to become a successful professional, improving her living situation in the city of Villanueva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for university studies

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca la pavana, el señor Mario G. González, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también establece cultivos agrícolas como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo los que le proveen el sustento de sus cuatro hijas y su esposa quienes también le ayudan en los que haceres diarios, el trabaja de seis a doce del medio día, en conjunto con su familia, el crédito solicitado será empleado para la compra postes, alambre, herbicidas y contratar mano de obra para mejorar su finca la cual es su fuente de ingreso y sostén familiar.
texts.en:
Mario G. G.raises cattle, pigs, and birds in the Somotillo municipality in the La Pavana region. He also grows crops such as corn, sesame, and sorghum. This provides the support for his four daughters and his wife. They also help with the daily chores. He works with his family from six until twelve noon. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy posts, wire, herbicides, and to pay for labor to improve his farm. The farm is his source of income and the family’s means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy posts, wire, and herbicides

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 46 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ceferina de 45 años, quien lo apoya en la chacra y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Se dedica a la siembra de papa, choclo, zanahorias, maíz y alverjas, los cuales después de cosecharlos vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde ya tiene varios clientes que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas; lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado, puesto que no quiere que los químicos le causen una enfermedad. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, pero para mejorar sus ganancias desea comprarse un auto con el cual él mismo pueda transportar sus cultivos.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Pedro con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de todos sus compañeros. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará insecticidas, ya que tiene que fumigar sus siembras.
texts.en:
Pedro is 46 years old and a father. He is very happy and a worker. He lives in his own house with his wife Ceferina who is 45 years old and helps him on the farm. What they want most is to have a better quality of life. He works planting potatoes, sweet corn, carrots, corn and peas, which after harvesting he sells in the oldest market in the city of Tarma where he already has several customers who know the quality of his product and don't hesitate to wait to buy them in bulk. What he likes most about his job is planting his land and making it fertile and productive. He has been in the business for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigating his farm, which he has to do very carefully since he doesn't want the chemicals to cause a disease. In the future he hopes to continue selling his products but to increase his income he wants to buy a car which he can use to transport his products. This is the eighth loan Pedro has had with MFP and he knows that he must make his payments on time if he wants to continue getting loans in the future. He is a responsible member of his communal bank and is concerned with the well-being of his friends. With the thousand nuevos soles he is requesting he will buy insecticides to fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticides

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata  Koné est âgée de 25 ans, mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit dans une famille traditionnelle  élargie avec sa grande sœur, belles sœurs, frères au quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença tôt le commerce auprès de sa sœur qui vendait des aliments et faisait de la coiffure. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle évolue seule en optant pour la préparation et la vente d’aliments. Elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant  5 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété.
Pour faire du couscous à base de fonio appelé « Djouka », elle procède préalablement par bien laver le fonio et l’assécher à l’aide d’un torchon en soie.  Une fois  cette opération achevée, elle procède à la cuisson après avoir mis de la poudre d’arachide.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé  pour acheter, 2 sacs d’arachide et 5 sacs de fonio. 
Elle  s’approvisionne sur place et  vend ses plats alimentaires au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Koné is 25 year old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in a traditional extended family with her older sister, sisters-in-law, and brothers in the Darsalam district of Ségou (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school due to societal reasons, she soon began in commerce with her sister, who used to sell foodstuff and work in hairstyling. After several years of apprenticeship, she is advancing on her own by opting to make and sell food. She has been in this business for five years now and enjoys a great reputation and fame. To make fonio couscous, called djouka, she proceeds beforehand by washing the fonio (a millet-like grain) very well and drying it by using a silk towel. Once this operation is completed, she proceeds to cooking it after adding some peanut powder. With plans to increase her working capital, in order to make more profit, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan, which will be used for buying two sacks of peanuts and five sacks of fonio. She gets her supplies locally, sells her prepared dishes, and accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that will allow her to help her husband and to take part in societal events.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for food catering

loans.name: Celia Ysabel

texts.en:
Celia Ysabel is part of the “Unidos para el Triunfo” community bank, which translates to “United for Triumph”. She is 28-years-old and lives with her spouse and their two daughters, ages 16 and 5. The older one, Wyni, attends a local high school while 5-year-old Camila is enrolled in kindergarten. Celia Ysabel supports her family by buying and selling various types of potatoes. She buys them from a wholesaler in the jungle region of Puerto Maldonado, and sells them to various restaurants around the city of Cuzco. 

Celia Ysabel will use her Kiva loan as business capital for her potato enterprise. She has received Kiva loans in the past, and hopes to further improve her business with the current loan cycle. She is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: For additional capital for her potato business

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman is a married man with three daughters who attend school. His wife is a farmer.

Athman is a water vendor. He has been in the business for seven years and sells water door-to-door. The main challenge to his business is that during the rainy season clients harvest rain water and he doesn't have many customers. His goal is to own a shop in the future and employ someone to operate the water business.

With the Ksh 40,000 loan, Athman wants to purchase more handcarts for carrying water and boost his wife's business by buying more chickens. He wanted to work with Yehu because he liked their polite staff members and the affordable terms.

loans.use: To buy more handcarts plus more chickens for his wife's business

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mr. Phun V., 42 and his wife, Mrs. Bunthorn Chea, 39, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have three children – one son and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker and the other two children study in a local school. The couple is shown in the photo.
Mr. Phun V. is a fisherman and does construction work. He is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to get to work and to build a restroom for his family to use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his daughter to get work and build a restroom for his family

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lai T. is 55 years old and is a villager who lives in Boueng Kroam village, Kandal province. She was selected as the leader of a group loan by the group's six members. Each member of this group loan will use their part of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Lai T. is a farmer who owns one hectare of land on which to grow crops. She decided to ask for a loan for her farm to buy fertilizer, rice seed and corn seed to support her farming crops. Aside from being a farmer, she is also a congee (rice porridge) seller who earns a little income to support her family's living costs. Mrs. Lai T. is a widow with four children; one is a farmer who supports her with the farming and the other three are teachers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and corn seed

loans.name: Semuuhen

texts.en:
Semuuhen N. is 55 years-old and lives with her family in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She and her family, a total of ten persons, live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

Since 2006, she has been selling a variety of socks outside of the local market and shops. Her husband is a driver for a local construction company and earns 250,000 MNT salary per month. Their daughter supports her trading business and has contributed  500,000 MNT to her parents. Semuuhen was ill in 2009 and had medical treatment in Ulaanbaatar.  She says “now I am recovered and happy to live with my big family”.  

Semuuhen is a hardworking and optimistic woman.  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase three sacks of socks in Ulaanbaatar at wholesale prices and she will resell them at retail prices in her native town.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and limes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy roof repair supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 28 años D. edad, es soltera, actualmente asume el cargo D. tesorera D. la alcancía comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad, desD. hace 5 años y medio, su alcancía comunal está conformada por 10 socios y se encuentra ubicada en El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, los socios realizan actividades como comercio y servicio. Silvia se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa por temporada como ambulante desD. hace 6 meses, se inicio a raíz que su familia la animó y apoyo para implementar su pequeño negocio, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo solo logra ahorrar lo poco que gana para poder invertirlo en su negocio. El gran sueño D. Silvia es tener un negocio propio D. ropas interiores y joyas.
El reciente préstamo será utilizado para la construcción D. su vivienda, todos los participantes D. la alcancía están muy contentos y agradecidos por la ayuda que se les brinda. (Niños en la foto hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old, single, and has become treasurer of the “María Elena Moyano” communal bank. This bank has worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad (Prosperity) for 5 ½ years. The bank is composed of 10 members and is located in El Agustino, department of Lima. All the members carry out activities relating to commerce and services. Silvia has bought and sold seasonal clothing in the streets for the last 6 months. She began because her family encouraged and helped her to start her small business. By means of her work alone, she saved the little that she earned to be able to invest in her business. Silvia's grand dream is to have a business selling underwear and jewelry. This recent loan will be used to construct her house. All the participants in the communal bank are very content and grateful for the help they are offered. (The children in the photo belong to the members.)

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCTING HER HOUSE

loans.name: Othon

texts.es:
Othon de 65 años, el tiene una tienda de víveres para solventar lo gastos familiares, vive en una casa de cemento y tablas, ubicada en el Fortín de Guayaquil. 

El comenzó a comprar víveres para solventar los gastos desde hace 15 años atrás por la falta de oportunidades, compro bebidas, granos, aceites etc. Ahora desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 05h30am todos los días.   

Para poder incrementar su negocio el quiere comprar mas víveres como aceites, arroz y vitrinas. En el futuro quiere agrandar mas la tienda para tener mas estabilidad económica y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Othon, age 65, owns a general store. The income from his business covers his family's living expenses. He lives in a cement and tile house located on Fortín de Guayaquil. Othon began his store when he was 15 years old, because there were no other work opportunities. He sold beverages, cereals, oil, etc. Ever since, Othon has gone to work everyday, starting at 5:30 a.m. To increase his sales, he wants to buy more provisions such as oil, rice, and display cabinets. In the future he wants to expand the store so that he has greater financial security and can finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of display cases

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita C. is from the village of Gango in Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old and married. She has two adult children. Leonita sells dried fish. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In July 2007, Leonita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more dried fish to sell. This will be Leonita’s fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Used to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Ngoun S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. buys rice to resell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband sells palm juice, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra M. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Alejandra is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Alejandra owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating transportation services. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Alejandra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Isais

texts.es: El señor Isaías L. es padre de familia de 2 pequeños de edades entre 1 y 5 años, la casa que el tiene es de interés social y esta ubicada en una calle muy transitada, el quiere poner en la parte de enfrente una barda para brindar a su hijos mayor protección cuando salgan al patio a jugar. Isaías y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora para que entre los dos puedan a ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Isaiah L. is a parent of 2 small children between ages of 1 and 5. The house he has is a low interest home and is located in a busy street. He wants to put in a front wall to provide their children greater protection when they go outside to play. Isaiah and his wife work in an assembly plant, and between the two of them, they can offer their family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Fence the front of his house

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola R. es una mujer dedicada a su hogar pero eso no impide que siempre ha contribuido en el lado economico, hace dos años empezo su negocio de venta de platillos los cuales elabora en su hogar, para  estar al pendiente de sus hijos y no descuidar su educacion, ella comenta que empezo vendiendo platillos los dias sabados con las personas de la construccion que trabajan por su colonia y poco a poco fueron pidiendole mas dias, en este momento realiza sus ventas los dias viernes sabado y domingo, ella refiere que los demas dias solo realiza encargos es decir que por adelantado le encargan la comida. El esposo de la señora Fabiola trabaja en una empresa que se dedica a la elaboracion de blocks, ladrillos y materiales para construccion. Los dias que descansa le ayuda a su esposa a la entrega de los platillos, es un negocio que les esta funcionando y piensan que vale la pena invertirle,es por eso la solicitud del credito.
texts.en: Fabiola R. is a woman who is very dedicated to her home, but this had not stopped her from always contributing on the economic side too.  Two years ago, she started her business selling dishes of food prepared in her home.  In order to watch her children and not neglect their education, she commented that she started selling food on Saturdays with the people who work in construction in her neighborhood and little by little they began to request more days.  Right now she sells on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  On the rest of the days she only does orders, that is to say when they request food ahead of time.  Her husband works in a business that makes blocks, bricks, and construction materials.  The days he does not work he helps his wife to deliver the food.  It is a business that is working for them and they think that it is worth investing in, that is why they have requested the loan.

loans.use: Investment in business.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadira del Carmen M. Rodríguez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace 11 años. Ella inicio este pequeño negocio con la venta de gaseosas luego poco a poco y gracias a los créditos fue surtiendo su venta con granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosa, refrescos…etc.
Ella tiene la meta de mejorar su negocio amentarlo y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Yadira del Carmen M. Rodríguez is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has owned her own small grocery store for 11 years.  She started this small business selling soda then, little by little and with the help of loans, she managed to stock her store with basic grains, dairy products, soda, soft drinks, etc.

Her goal is to improve and expand her business and to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as basic grains, dairy products, soda and soft drinks

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a resident of Mughalpura, which is a small housing colony in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 15 years ago. 

She is a seamstress, collecting orders from her neighboring clients and providing them finished work in the given time period to earn an income. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. The earned amount helps her pay utility expenses. Her husband is a painter and paints walls, doors and windows on order. He is a daily wage worker and works for house and building owners. He has been involved in this business for the past 15 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy different colors of paint and paintbrushes that will help him provide better quality services to his customers. Nasreen is hopeful that the loan investment will help her husband in making more income, and she will be able to return the loan easily in installments. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with a hand up is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy paint and paintbrushes for her husband's painting business

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence is 35 years old and is married with five children between 9 and 18 years old. She has a general store that sells many products including water, jus, and milk.  She has been in this business for 23 years and employs one other person to help her.

Providence has requested a loan to purchase a large stock of items that she can then wholesale to other vendors and store owners.  In particular, she would like to start with sugar, as it is in much need in her village.  Through access to this loan, Providence has hope for the future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and other items to wholesale

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario Alberto V. B. tiene 26 años, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la esposa y con el hijo,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mario Alberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un terreno propio.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto V. B. is 26 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Mario Alberto is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in the García and López shopping areas and sells his products in the Vaca shopping area.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own his own plot of land.  

Mario Alberto likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Adrian José

texts.es:
El Señor Adrian José Solís Q., trabaja como higienista en el Mercado Oriental, desde hace 5 años.
Es casado tiene 4 personas a su cargo su señora y tres hijos, uno de ellos es menor de 15 años en edad escolar.
Lleva 8 créditos trabajando con CEPRODEL, con los cuales han permitido incrementar su calidad de vida y le han servido en muchas cosas como gastos de salud, gastos escolares y para su comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Adrian José Solís Q. is a hygienist in the Mercado Oriental: he has been working there for 5 years.
He is married and he is economically in charge of 4 people: his wife and his 3 children, one of which, aged 15, goes to school.
He has been working with CEPRODEL for 8 cycles, and these loans have helped him improving his living condition, as they have been used mainly to pay for medical expenses, school expenses and to buy his house.

loans.use: To finish paying for the purchase of his house.

loans.name: Rhode

texts.es:
La señora Rhode es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del distrito de Calleria y Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad.
La señora Rhode vende productos naturales que son pedidos por catálogo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años, ésto gracias a los préstamos que le ha brindado Manuela Ramos.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,500 soles invertirá en la compra de mas productos naturales como 2 frascos de batidos, 2 frascos de proteínas, 2 cajitas de te energizanté, 1 frasco de multivitamina, y un par de productos más.
La señora Rhode agradece la oportunidad que ha tenido en Manuela Ramos para poder tener un capital propio y trabajarlo.   Gracias a ello ha podido solventar varios gastos.
texts.en:
Rhode is a member of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias. They are located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 57 years old, is widowed and has three grown children. 

Rhode sells natural products that are ordered by catalog. She has been in this business for six years thanks to the loans extended to her by field partner Manuela Ramos. 

With this loan of 1500 soles (PEN) she will invest in purchasing more natural products such as two bottles of smoothies, two bottles of protein, two bottles of energizing tea, one bottle of multivitamins and other products. 

Rhode appreciates the opportunity she has had in Manuela Ramos in order to have working capital and work it. Thanks to this she has been able to pay various expenses.

loans.use: Purchase natural products.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar: حسن في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في بيع قوارير الغاز له في عمله نحو 12 سنة يحب عائلته وهي كل اهتمامه يحلم في تطوير نفسه بحيث يصبح صاحب سوبر ماركت كبير لكن يتنقصه المادة لتحقيق حلمه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة عدد قوارير الغاز لديه واعادة بيعها له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم بدعم عائلته وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Hasan is 34 years old and married with 1 child. He has been selling gas canisters for the past 12 years. He very much loves his family and dreams of one day owning his own supermarket; for the moment, however, he doesn’t quite have enough capital for that. Hasan’s last loan from Al Majmoua was very helpful and he would now like to ask for another to purchase more gas canisters.

loans.use: To purchase gas canisters

loans.name: Nury De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Desde hace mucho tiempo Nury aprendió la labor de cuidar  animales para el sustento de su familia. Actualmente Nury cria cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos y de esta forma ha podido educar a sus hijos, algunos de ellos ya son  profesionales.

Nury necesita ampliar su negocio para poder incrementar sus ingresos, ya que solo tiene 5 cerdos y necesita comprar unos mas y mejorar las condiciones de los animales, de esta manera crecen y se pueden alimentar mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Nury learned how to raise animals for her family’s support a long time ago.  She currently raises pigs to fatten them up and then sell.  In this way she has managed to educate her children; some of them are already professionals.

Nury needs to expand the business to increase income because she only has 5 pigs and needs to buy a few more and to improve the living conditions of the animals so that they will grow and be fed better.

loans.use: For pig sty improvements.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Isidro  de 58 años y sus cinco hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo de los tres menores pues el resto ya trabaja y se mantienen, pero juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace tres años,  esta emprendedora mujer se dedica al comercio de gaseosas y cervezas en su casa. Dice que el negocio es tranquilo y le brinda generosas ganancias pues muchas veces ofrece su sala para que sus clientes puedan consumir gaseosa o cerveza, es por esta razón que la prefieren, pues tiene mayor salida de cervezas durante los fines de semana. Cuando ella debe salir la apoyan en el negocio sus hijos o su esposo, pues ella es una dirigente zonal muy dedicada. Como es una dama muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado habilitar el lado de afuera de su casa con piso de cemento y colocar ahí mesas y sillas para que sus clientes tengan un espacio adecuado donde tomar las bebidas que ofrece. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de gaseosas y cervezas pues quiere incrementar sus ventas y ganancias para continuar adelante.
texts.en:
María, 49, lives with her husband, Isidro, 58, in their own house.  They have five children: 3 still live with them, and two are already working and supporting themselves, but together they strive every day to get ahead.   For the last three years this entrepreneurial woman has been selling soft drinks and beer in her house.  She says that the business is peaceful and gives her good earnings.  Often she lets her customers use her living room to drink the sodas or beer, and that is why they like her.  She sells more beer on the weekends.  
When María needs to go out, her children or her husband help her, since she is a hard-working regional manager.  Since she is such an entrepreneurial woman, in the future she plans to fix up the side of her house with a cement floor and put out tables and chairs where her customers will have enough space to enjoy the drinks that she sells.  This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments in the established time period.  She doesn’t want to look bad to the people who have made the money possible to allow her to continue working in search of improvement.  María will use the loan to buy a large number of soft drinks and beer so she can increase her sales and income to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: To supply her business with soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo H. (in the picture) is 43 years old and his wife, Chuth Chan, is 34 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2004, and have one young daughter.     

Sambo is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Khanewal which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanti Nagar for the past 15 years in a 2-room brick house with her family. 

She is married to S. Q. who is engaged in an animal-selling business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers. He purchases young goats and sheep at cheap prices and sells them after raising them.
 
Razia herself is a seamstress, involved in a business sewing clothes. She does this work for her neighboring clients to earn income for the family. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are very young and have not started to attend school yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase some goats and sheep to earn more profit through selling. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Razia is hopeful that an investment will put his business in a more profitable position. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for animal selling business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey O. N. is forty-nine years old.  He is married and he and his wife have seven children aged between sixteen and three years old, whom they hope to educate to university level. His business is located at a busy market known as Juakali in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin. 

Godfrey runs a well-known auto spare parts shop by the name of Tumaini Spare Parts Shop. In addition to the shop, he also runs a garage in the same place. He has been operating this business for eighteen years now and has managed to provide employment to ten people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraint. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Godfrey is using this loan of Kes 50,000 to increase his inventory of auto spare parts to expand his buisness and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and be able to import car engines from Dubai. In the future, he sees himself owning a transport business. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: increase his inventory of spare parts

loans.name: Omar Adolfo

texts.es:
El cliente Omar Adolfo L. V.. Vive en el municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león del centro de salud 1/2c al sur, Es Casado tiene 3 hijos a su cargo  trabaja actual mente Trabaja en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como administrador tiene 10 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación en malas condiciones el cual la quiere mejorar, ya que noto el cambio con la mejora de a través del financiamiento con Ceprodel, por tal razón que está solicitando un nuevo crédito, para la construcción de un porche de entrada en su vivienda.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de sementó y Ladrillos para la construcción de un porche. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia
texts.en:
The client is Omar Adolfo L. V.. He lives in the city of Santa Rosa Del Peñón in the department of león del centro de salud 1/2c al sur. He is married and he has three children. He works in  Santa Rosa Del Peñón where he is an administrator. He has worked in this setting for 10 years.
The client has a house that is in bad shape that he wants to improve. Now he has realized the improvements are possible through the funding provided by Ceprodel.  For this reason, he is requesting a new loan in order to build a front porch for his home.
This credit will be used for the purchase of cement and bricks for the construction of the porch.
This allows him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: buy cement and bricks to build a porch

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 and is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 20. Her husband works as a farm harvester.
Erlinda has been in the hog-raising business for three years. She has a small backyard piggery. She hopes to expand her piggery and raise more pigs. Erlinda also makes "amakan", a weaved bamboo used for walls of houses in the Philippines.
This loan will be used to purchase bamboo for weaving, and also feed for the pigs. In the future, Erlinda hopes her children will finish their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for weaving and pig feed.

loans.name: Miriam Yanceli

texts.es:
Los deseos de Miriam de progresar han sido el motor que la impulsan a trabajar día a día, ella vende de mercancía, la cual se ha convertido de gran ayuda puesto que debe generar ingresos debido a que su familia cuenta con bajos recursos económicos, a sus 29 años de edad Miriam es madre de 6 hijos a quienes ha querido brindarles la mejor calidad de vida.

Miriam es una luchadora que a pesar de haber tenido dificultades de orden público ha salido adelante y enfrentado la adversidad con mucha tenacidad, sueña con poder comprar en un futuro una moto que le facilite su labor y le permita poder tener mas ventas y así proporcionalmente ir aumentando sus ingresos. Sin embargo en este momento Miriam solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar mas mercancía y así poder tener más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes, logrando un posicionamiento frente a los otros vendedores que están en el sector.
texts.en:
Miriam’s wish to progress has been the motivator that pushes her to work every day.  She sells merchandise.  This has become a great help because she has to earn income because her family is low income.  At the age of 29, Miriam is the mother of 6 children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

Miriam is a fighter who, despite having had public order difficulties, has continued moving forward and facing adversity with much tenacity.  She dreams with buying a motorcycle in the future that will ease her work and allow her to have more sales and thus increase her income proportionately.

However, at this moment Miriam is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to have more products to offer her customers thus attaining a position in front of the other vendors in the sector.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Victoria Eloisa

texts.es:
Victoria Eloisa tiene 48 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los seis hijos todos menores de edad. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Victoria se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es viajar a Galapagos.

Le gusta escuchar usica y bailar.
texts.en:
Victoria Eloisa is 48 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their six dependent children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  This group has 10 members who all work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Victoria is a farmer.  In particular, she grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the street market in the town.

Victoria is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs and increase her production.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests which attack her crops.  Her dream is to travel to the Galapagos Islands.

Victoria enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban trabaja como  mecánico en un taller que comparte con un chapista de vehículos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas de trabajo, como ser una gata, estuche de dados, arco para soldadura. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciado  y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente trabaja con Impro y por el rubro en el que trabaja se está canalizando este crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Esteban works as a mechanic in a workshop that he shares with a panel beater.  He needs this loan to buy work tools such as a jack, a socket set and a welding arc.

Esteban lives in his own home which is located in Villa Nueva Potosí district, in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced and has five children.  This is the first time that he has worked with Impro and, because of the field in which he works, his loan request is being channelled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a jack, a socket set and a welding arc for his car repair shop

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es: La señora Estefanía tiene una tienda  D. barrio. La cual esta ubicada en su mismo domicilio; atienD. con la ayuda D. su nieta D. 10 años quien es hija D. su hija menor la cual vive con ella.  Es viuda hace 2 años, el préstamo que saco es para surtir mas su tienda comprando mercadería como dulces abarrotes refrescos y D. esta manera mejorar sus ingresos familiares, ella agradece a la institución por darle la oportunidad D. mejorar sus ingresos con la compra D. nuevos productos para su tienda, es una persona mayor pero sigue trabajando, para así ayudar con los gastos D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Estefania manages a neighborhood store from her home. She receives help from her 10-year-old granddaughter, the child of her youngest daughter who still lives with her. Estefania became a widow two years ago.

The loan she is taking out will be used to restock her store with more merchandise such as candy, groceries, and soft drinks so that she can improve the family income. She is grateful to Emprender for giving her the opportunity to improve her earnings with the purchase of new products for her store. Even though she is a senior citizen, Estefania continues to work so that she can help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Robinson Santiago

texts.es: Robinson, de 50 años vive con su cónyuge y sus dos estudiantes hijos, en las edades de 10 y 22 años, en un barrio muy alegre de gente trabajadora, ubicado al sur de la ciudad. Allí se dedica a la fabricación de prendas de vestir, en las líneas de pantalones y camisas femeninas, esta actividad la aprendió gracias a que su hermana trabajó durante muchos años en una empresa de confecciones, y cuando ella lo vio desesperado por no tener trabajo lo dejó como su administrador y allí aprendió a elaborar prendas de vestir y a manejar las maquinarias.  Para Robinson confeccionar es justamente lo que le ha funcionado en su vida, porque con este oficio logró adquirir su  propia casa, organizar su hogar y alcanzar muchas metas más en su familia,  que es su felicidad. Ahora su pequeña hija tiende a seguir sus pasos pues no se desprende de él lo observa en todo momento y en su tiempo libre juega a ser modista, elaborando la ropa de sus muñecas. En la actualidad el negocio de Robinson genera empleos y planea incrementar su producción, mediante la aplicación del capital de trabajo que obtendrá por financiamientos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará en volúmenes telas e insumos, para aumentar la producción y responder a su clientela, la cual demanda productos con nuevos y modernos diseños. . Mientras Robinson trabaja para lograr sus metas, maneja en su negocio un margen de utilidad no menor del 25 % que poco a poco planea aumentar y una liquidez de 3 a 1. Su desafío más importante es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales de éxito y es que ellos son especialmente el motor de su vida.
texts.en:
Robinson is 50 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, 10 and 22, who are both students.  He lives in a very friendly neighborhood of hard-working people to the south of the city.  There he makes clothing such as pants and women's shirts for a living.  He learned this activity, even though he didn't have any prior experience, thanks to his sister who, for many years, worked in a clothing company.  There was a time when he felt hopeless because he didn't have a job and she made him her manager.  There he learned how to make clothing and operate the machines and this is precisely what he has been doing with his life.  With his sister's help he was able to buy his own house and organize it, in addition to the many achievements that have contributed to his happiness.  Now his young daughter is following in his footsteps as she is very attached to him and watches him work.  In her free time she plays at making clothing for her dolls.  

Currently, Robinson's business is generating jobs and he plans to increase his production through the use of working capital that he will obtain through loans.  This is the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan which he will use to buy fabrics and supplies in volume to increase his production and respond to his customers who demand new and modern designs.  While Robinson works to attain his goals, he manages his business with a profit margin of no less than  25% which he plans to increase little by little and a liquidity of 3 to 1.  

His greatest challenge is to see his children become successful professionals as they are what drives him in life.

loans.use: purchase fabric and supplies in volume to increase his production and meet his customer's demands.

loans.name: Welliam

texts.en:
Welliam is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Welliam has a shop that sells cocoa fruits, coffee fruits and bananas. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy bananas and cocoa fruits for sale.

Welliam is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Welliam hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and cocoa fruits for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Juliet has a business selling paper products, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase paper for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.        

Juliet is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: buy paper products

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Melody is engaged in retailing charcoal and rice in their village to generate additional income. She is a mother who has two school-aged children. She aims to sell more charcoal and rice to earn more income and support the education of their children since her husband's income is not sufficient to satisfy all their needs. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy additional stocks of charcoal and rice to sell in the village. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income. She is hoping that in the future, they will overcome poverty and uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal and rice to sell in the village.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 35 years old, married to Joseph. Together they are blessed with four children. She is a greengrocer (a retail trader in fruit and vegetables) in the Tala market selling things like cabbages, onions, carrots and tomatoes. She has been in the business for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES.5,000.


This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She plans to buy more stock of assorted vegetables for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and provide for the basic needs of her family. 

Her dream is to purchase a plot for the family and establish her business there. She is very hardworking

loans.use: To buy cabbage, onions, carrots, and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos de 47 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijas.  Él es un hombre trabajador y sobre todo muy entregado a su familia. Ha trabajado duramente toda su vida para poder dar a su familia el pan de cada día. Gracias a Dios y a su trabajo ha logrado comprar un camión el cual le sirve para ganarse la vida ya que con el vehículo realiza viajes tanto de material como de personas. Cuenta con mucha clientela fija ya que él se caracteriza por ser un hombre responsable, honesto y dedicado a su trabajo. Muchas personas lo prefieren y contratan sus servicios ya que el ofrece precios accesibles a la hora de realizar los viajes. Últimamente la demanda de sus servicios ha aumentado, esto ha hecho que su vehículo  se deteriore y necesite ciertas reparaciones. Esto ha motivado a Marcos a solicitar este crédito para invertir en la reparación de su vehículo ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos. Además es importante tener el vehículo en buenas condiciones para garantizar un buen servicio a sus clientes. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos, 47, lives in his own house with his family which consists of his wife and three daughters.  He’s a hardworking man who is devoted to his family.  He’s worked hard his entire life to provide his family with daily nourishment.  Thanks to God and to his work he has managed to buy a truck that he uses to earn his livelihood transporting both people and merchandise.  He has quite a few regular customers since he’s responsible, honest and dedicated to his work.  Many people prefer him and contract his services because he offers affordable prices when trips are carried out.  

Lately, demand for his services has increased and this has caused his truck to start having mechanical problems and needs to be repaired.  This has motivated Marcos to request this loan to invest in vehicle repair since it’s his main source of income.  Besides, it’s important to have the vehicle in good operating conditions to guarantee good customer service.  He hopes to improve his and his family’s quality of life in this way.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Zandan

texts.en: Zandan is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a mongolian yurt in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, his elder son is a college student, and his younger son goes to school. He started his business in 2000 by buying tennis and billiard tables. Now, his wife runs the business and he drives his own car as a taxi. Their workspace is large enough for storage, so he decided to rent it as a warehouse. In order to rent it as a warehouse, he needs to install a heating system in the area. When he installs a new heating system, the warehouse has potential income of 500,000-900,000 MNT per month. He is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT, which he will use to maintain his workspace and to install heating.

loans.use: to install heating in a warehouse

loans.name: Magno Group

texts.es:
Doña Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, ella tiene 34 años y es casada y tiene 3 niños que dependen de ella. Platica que desde hace 2 años empezó un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras de temporada en una población cercana a su comunidad dice que emprendió el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar por que no le alcanzaba, comenta que a diario va a la central de abastos a surtir de fruta y legumbre y cuando es temporada de aguacate ella los corta de sus árboles que tiene en su casa. Lupita como de cariño le dicen está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, ella vende de casa en casa y en el mercado de la ciudad, ella vende aguacate, chiles manzanos, nopales, acelgas, guayabas, duraznos, uvas etc. Ella dice “gracias a todas las personas que nos ayudan a través de los créditos por que así nos ayudan a darle a nuestros hijos una mejor calidad de vida”. 
Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman María de Jesús, Silvia y Roldan ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de productos por catalogo de plástico para cocina, en puercos para criarlos y después venderlos y en frutas y verduras para su venta.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 children who depend on her. She remarks that 2 years ago she started a business selling fruit and vegetables in season in a small town near her community. She says she learned the business to help her husband with the household expenses because they couldn't make ends meet. She says that she goes to the distribution center every day to stock up on fruit and vegetables and in avocado season she cuts them from the trees she has at her house. Lupita, as she is affectionately called, is asking for a loan to keep investing in her business. She sells door to door and in the city market. She sells avocados, chiles, apples, nopales, swiss chard, guayabas, peaches, grapes, etc. She says “thanks to everyone who helped through through the loans because they help us to give our children a better quality of life."
 
The other three members of the group are named María de Jesús, Silvia and Roldan. They will invest their loans in buying plastic kitchen products via catalog and pigs to raise and sell as well as in fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children and only 4 of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on retail basis. She also has a retail shop where she generates additional income. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has requested for a loan of 800000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of oranges, pineapples and mangoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to increase on her capital base so as to serve more customers and also to become a wholesaler and a farmer of fruits. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy boxes of oranges pineapples and mangoes

loans.name: Medard

texts.en:
Medard is 40 years old and married with five children between the ages of 7 and 18. He owns a business selling various goods such as toilet paper, soap, and sugar. He has 8 years' experience in this business, and he works from 6:00 am until 8:30 pm six days a week. 

Medard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will reinvest in his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Juana has a shop from which she sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON products.

Juana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Juana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON products.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es: La señora Luz Amparo a sus 42 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad. La señora Luz Amparo se dedica a la fabricación de bolsas plásticas, ésta actividad la aprendió hace varios años de unos familiares. En febrero del año 2007, la señora Luz Amparo decide emprender su propio taller de fabricación de bolsas plásticas especialmente para fábricas de arepas. Esta actividad, la alterna la señora Luz Amparo con su trabajo como madre comunitaria. La señora Luz Amparo necesita comprar materia prima como plástico, aceites y carbón; que le permitan incrementar su nivel de producción y venta. Con lo anterior, la señora Luz Amparo desea mejorar su calidad de vida y bienestar de su familia y a futuro tener su negocio muy grande y en un mercado bien consolidado.
texts.en: Señora Luz Amparo, who is 42 years old, is the mother of two children, ages 17 and 15. Her work is making plastic bags. She learned this business a number of years ago from some relatives. In February of 2007, Señora Luz Amparo decided to set up her own workshop to make plastic bags, especially plastic bags for arepas (corn griddle cakes) factories.
