She alternates this business with her work as a female community leader. Señora Luz needs to buy basic materials such as plastic, oils, and charcoal, which will permit her to increase her level of production and sales. With these items, Señora Luz wants to improve her quality of life and the well-being of her family and in the future to have a very large business and a well-consolidated market.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as plastic, oils, and charcoal

loans.name: Lion Group

texts.en:
Shumirai is 42 years old.  She is married and resides in Masvingo, Zimbabwe with her four children aged 19, 16, 10 and seven years who are all attending school.  In addition, Shumirai takes care of her sister's child.  Her husband is employed as a teacher.

Shumirai is involved in a variety of business activities.  Her core business is knitting sweaters, but she also works in the poultry business, the cross-border trading business and the manufacturing of peanut butter.  Shumirai has been in business for 20 years and employs three workers.  

She is requesting a loan of $300 to buy knitting materials and livestock feed.  She will combine any unspent funds from this loan with her own resources to expand her ventures.  The two main challenges she faces in all of these business ventures are the shortage of electricity and competition.  With the additional income generated from this loan, Shumirai will be able put enough good food on the table for her family and send her children to school.  In the next five years, she plans to start a food processing company.

loans.use: to purchase knitting materials and livestock feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay laborers for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 41, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Arbi, a mechanic. She is also mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 32,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lorna hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ahmedwali Hassan

texts.en: Ahmedwali Hassan is 23 years old. He studies at Gollis unversity. He faces a major problem in both his learning and teaching. His problem is the lack of a laptop to learn and to teach. He came to Kaaba MFI to lend him a laptop and finally, Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in monthly installments. After finishing his university, Ahmedwali hopes to work as a secondary teacher.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de joyeria de enchape y productos de usos personal por catalogo se dedica a esa actividad desde hace mas de 15 años y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor y asi continuar con sus ventas.

loans.use: comprar joyeria de enchape y productos de usos personal

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en: Vasil M. has special engineering education but he was not able to find an engineering job so after his graduation he started to work as a restaurant manager. In 1990 he decided to start an own business and opened one of the first grocery stores in the city. Later when the big food chain stores opened their stores in Bourgas vasil had to close his grocery. Then two years ago he opened a small manufacture for cereal and cornflakes. He has no serious competition and the products he makes are very attractive. Now Vasil M. needs a packing machine for his manufacture. The loan amount is $ 2000.

loans.use: To buy a packing machine

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto owns a bicycle sales and repair shop. He started his business about 13 years ago with the money he saved from a job he had. He has done well with his business, and he has been able to also turn a small part of his shop into a general store. Jacinto will use the money from the KIVA loan to invest in a paper, pens and other supplies now that the school year is about to begin. He is 42 years old and has two children. His wife is a teacher that works at a nearby elementary school. He hopes that with the profits from his general store he will be able to buy more tools for his bike shop.

loans.use: Invest in school supplies

loans.name: Muni

texts.en: Muni is 43 years old, married, and has four daughters. Muni and her husband, Amid, sell frogs to several restaurants. They sell each frog for 2 cents and in a day they can sell 500 frogs. Muni needs a loan of $75. With this loan, she can buy more frogs and thus more or less double her income. Muni very much wants to earn more money  for her childrens' education and to give them a better life than what she grew up with.

loans.use: to buy more frogs

loans.name: Matagiaila

texts.en: Matagiaila is a very artistic and creative woman as she specializes in doing elei printing. She started her elei business this year, and was able to do it well. She is a hard working mother who struggles to do what is best for her family's future. Her elei printings are being sold to many people especially tourists that come over to visit our country. Matagiaila has realized that having a business helps her out in so many ways like funding her childrens' school, buying extra materials for the business, home improvement and most importantly to pay up her weekly payments. According to her weekly budget, she earns $300.00 per week after deductions have been made.

loans.use: Matagiaila would like to buy fabrics and paints for her traditional elei painting.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a low-income inhabitant of Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has her shop near her house. She has been running this business for 6 years. She wants to borrow $1000 from Normicro to increase business volume.  She hopes this investment would improve her family needs reasonably.

loans.use: to increase inventory volume

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif is 42, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He has his own farm. Vasif started his business 10 years ago. He plans to buy fertilizer in order to improve his business, and therefore he is applying for a loan of $725.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
This is 25 year-old Mrs. Hadija A.. She is married to husband Shabani with whom she has one son, 5 year-old Warda. Hadija requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional stock for her newly-established business, a shop where she sells various groceries and other small items. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock, such as candy, nuts, and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Costeñitas 2 Group

texts.es:
The association Costenitas 2 is located in a place called Focal de Villa Adela in the city of El Alto. The association has 22 active members, each of them dedicated to a specific trade which helps sustain their families. Some of the activities include handicrafts, knitting and the sales of every day household and seasonal items. The majority of the members have stands in the fairs and markets which depend on this type of commerce.

The association requires capital to buy supplies for their businesses. They are starting a busy season for the kinds of products and items they sell. This will allow them to generate more income to meet the needs of their families.

La asociación Costeñitas 2, actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo 5 dentro del centro Focal de Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto, cuenta con 22 socias activas, las cuales se dedican a distintos rubros para el sustento de sus familias. Entre las tantas actividades, encontramos a socias que se dedican a la artesanía, tejidos, comercio de mercadería de todo tipo y por temporadas. En su mayoría, las socias poseen puestos de venta en ferias y mercados específicos dependiendo de la mercadería con la que comercian Actualmente esta asociación requiere de capital, principalmente para abastecer sus negocios, preparando la temporada de inicio de clases de la gestión 2008, en vista que es una temporada alta para la venta del tipo de productos que las socias precisan vender para generar sus recursos y hacer frente a las necesidades de sus familias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE 22 WOMAN OF THIS ASSOCIATION NEED CAPITAL TO BUY SUPPLIES FOR THEIR VARIOUS BUSINESSES AND PREPARE FOR A BUSY SEASON.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is a 29-year-old single mother who supports her 2 young children.  She is a trader who sells children’s clothing at the local market.  Currently, she fills her basket with clothes and heads off to the market to sell her products to local customers, but she would one day like to have her own shop in which to sell her clothes.  She is requesting $325 to buy children’s clothing, such as dresses, jeans and shirts.  In addition, Patience is also a member of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothing, such as dresses, jeans and shirts.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a hardworking 56 year old woman who has been working for as long as she can remember. She lives in the Laureles Sur area and is a single mother to three grown children, whom she is proud to have raised with a lot of effort selling new and used clothing door to door in municipalities outside of Managua.

She started her business the day that she decided to save the small amount of money that her parents would give her until she was able to buy her first bundle of clothing. It's been 40 years since then and nothing has stopped her from getting ahead in life. So much so that she has been able to buy each of her children a plot of land and helped them build their homes, modest as the one they grew up in, but theirs nonetheless. Now that she lives alone she would like to build a wall on the back of her small house in order to be more protected. She will pay for it with her work. Her biggest dream is that her children never forget the importance of hard work that she instilled in them.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Elena es un esforzada mujer de 56 años de edad quien ha trabajado desde que tiene uso de razón , habita en Laureles Sur y es madre soltera de tres hijos ya adultos a quienes con orgullo saco adelante con su propio esfuerzo vendiendo ropa usada y nueva de casa en casa en otros municipios fuera de Managua, inicio su negocio el primer dia que tomo la decisión de ahorrar el dinerito que sus padres le daban hasta que pudo comprar una primera paca de ropa de esto hace 40 años desde entonces nada la ha detenido para salir adelante, tanto así que les logro comprar a cada uno de sus hijos su terreno y les ayudo a construir su casa humilde como en la que nacieron pero con un techo propio. Ahora que vive sola quiere hacer en la parte trasera de su casita un muro que le de mas protección y que pagará con su trabajo, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos nunca pierdan el valor del trabajo que ella les inculcó.

loans.use: To build a wall on the back of her house

loans.name: Mov

texts.en:
Mr. Mov E. and his wife married in 1988. They have three children; one son and two daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mov and his wife make Khmer noodles for selling. They have been doing this business for seven years.

Mr. Mov is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase rice for making Khmer noodle.

loans.use: To purchase rice for making Khmer Noodle

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity E. is 37 years old, married, with 2 children. Charity owns a small store where she sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. Everyday, she works from 8 am to 7 pm at her store. Charity hopes for a loan of $350 to enable her to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs and water for sale. This, she says, will help her meet her customer demand. In addition, she has 9 years experience in business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Faaofo

texts.en: Faaofo M., 59, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro/banana/cows business. She sells to the village community / District 3 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $125 USD.  SPBD loans are Faaofo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use part of her loan to assist her with her children's school needs,and for buying new equipment.

loans.use: The  loan will be used for replacing all tool; shovels ,bush knives,wheelbarrows,spades ,axes and  also coromozone chemicals etc

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Nguyen, 42 years old, joined the Fund in 2001.  Her family's main profession is working the farm and building milling machines.  When joining the fund, the family made plans to invest in raising livestock, and with the income from this business they built milling machines.  They then used the milling machines to process waste wheat and rice for the pigs, so the cost of feed is kept very low.  Each year, on average, the family produces about 500 kg of pigs.  Doing business involving the livestock operation fits the family very well, their finances are improving day by day.  She has 3 children, 2 who are still in school and 1 who is working and helping to support the family.  In this round of funding she and the family are requesting 16,000,000 to continue investing in livestock.  Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month. 
Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Tính 42 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001, nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng và làm máy xay sát, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã bàn bạc đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, với thuận lợi gia đình chị làm máy xay sát nên tân dụng được cám, tấm thừa vãi nên chi phí đầu tư thức ăn cho việc chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị là rất ít, hàng năm bình quân ra đình chi xuất khoảng 5 tạ lợn, kinh doanh kết hợp cùng với chăn nuôi đó chính là một cách làm ăn rất tốt với gia đình chị, kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, chị có 3 con, 2 con đang còn đi học, 1 con đang đã đi làm và có thu nhập phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 16.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: invest in raising livestock

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana is a member of Banco Comunal Compartir.

Feliciana is married. She’s 38 years old and has 3 children. Feliciana is from the San Martin de Paraiso community, district of Pacaycasa, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Feliciana has land where she grows tara pods and cochineal insects, and she also buys from others in the area, after gathering them she sells them in the city of Huanta.

Feliciana also travels weekly to the city of San Vicente, in the Cañete district, where she leases a stand where she sells, potatoes, cereals, breads and cheeses that she bring from the city of Ayacucho. At that same stand she buys tara pods and cochineal insects which she sells in the city of Lima.

Feliciana needs a loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will invest in the purchase of tara pods, cochineal insects and potatoes.

Feliciana wishes to buy land in the city of Cañete, build her home, improve her business and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal Compartir.

Feliciana es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Feliciana es de la comunidad de San Martín de Paraíso, distrito de Pacaycasa, que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Feliciana tiene terrenos donde cosecha tara y cochinilla, además compra de los productores de su zona, luego de acopiar lo vende en la ciudad de Huanta.

Además Feliciana viaja semanalmente a la ciudad de San Vicente, distrito de Cañete donde tiene un puesto que es alquilado en donde vende papa, cereales, panes quesos que lleva de la ciudad de Ayacucho, también en el mismo puesto compra tara y cochinilla que vende en la ciudad de Lima.

Feliciana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla y papa. Lo sueños de Feliciana son comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Cañete, construir su casa, su negocio mejore y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Feliciana needs a 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan which will be invested in the purchase of tara pods, cochineal insects and potatoes.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del Banco Comunal “Jerusalén II”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la  confección y venta de bijouteria (joyas), también vende zapatos, ropas y los materiales que se necesita en este trabajo. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos, confecciona en su domicilio y luego sale a repartir a sus clientes y en busca de otros clientes y de esa manera asegurar sus ventas.    

Se inició en esta actividad hace 2 años ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para atender los requerimientos de sus hijos. Frente a la separación con su esposo, empezó a vender ropa y zapatos, ahora también vende bijuteria (joyas).

Con el préstamo de S/. 1 000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará ropa para niños(as), adultos (varón y mujer) de diferentes marcas y modelos y también comprará materiales para su bijuteria y de esa manera sus clientes podrán tener mayor opción para escoger.

Angela tiene 59 años, es una mujer capaz de dirigir y administrar el negocio, su   meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en el futuro verlos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela is a member of the communal bank “Jerusalem II.” She lives in the department and province of San Martin, District of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to the creation and sale of jewelry and she also sells shoes, clothes, and the materials needed for her work. She works on the basis of orders and makes items in her home and then distributes to her customers and looks for new clients, thus ensuring her sales. She began two years ago before needing to generate income to provide for the needs of her children. Faced with the separation from her husband, she began selling clothes and shows and now she also sells jewelry. With a loan of 1,000 soles (US $350), which will be paid off in 6 months, she will buy clothes for children, adults (male and female) of various brands and models and will also buy materials for jewelry so that her customers will have more options to choose from. Angela is 59 years old and is woman who is capable of directing and administering her business; her goal is to continue growing her business and to support her children in their studies so that they can become professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults of different brands and models

loans.name: Ipu

texts.en:
Ipu F., 50, is married with 8 children. She has three years of experience in the taxi service business. She runs the taxi 6 days per week and she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

Ipu has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Ipu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be use to buy petrol and strung oil for the taxi. Sometimes when she felt sick then her husband will help her in operating the taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase strung oil and petrol

loans.name: Fahima

texts.en:
Fahima is a woman who has been involved in retail shopkeeping for more than 3 years. She lives in a household of 5 members, including her husband. He was out of the country for 5 years and she couldn't support his family there and her husband helped them, but when she came to Kabul she tried to help her husband and family so she would like to expand her business.

Therefore she requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to complete her stock and further her business to help her family and make a better life in Afghanistan for all the family.

She is happy with this loan process. She plans to open a shop for her husband in the next 2 or 3 years. She would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic process of small loans in this country. She would like to be a good businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To complete her stock

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 63 años, vive con sus 3 hijos. Tiene una pequeña tienda desD. hace 20 años, ha sabido forjarse en la vida una actividad que le permita estar activa y siempre  en constantes quehacer, y es lo que hace disfrutar a Elsa, pues lo ve como una distracción el D. poder brindar a sus clientes una buena atención en cada compra D. los productos D. pan llevar que consumen D. su tienda. Estos años D. experiencia le ha servido para saber cómo vender y qué estrategias D. ventas se aplican, es por ello que permanece en su negocio, además D. darle lo necesario para poder vivir, ella  tiene sus propios ingresos con la que pueD. disponer D. sus gastos, sus hijos ya son personas adultas que cuidan D. ella, pero están felices por tener una madre muy trabajadora. Para Elsa esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ya que en la primera fue muy responsable con sus cuotas D. devolución. Solicita este préstamo con el que comprará varios sacos D. víveres para que D. esa manera  pueda tener mayor stock D. mercadería.
texts.en:
Elsa is 63 years old and lives with her 3 children. She has had a small store for 20 years, has known how to make herself a life full of activity that allows her to be active and always with tasks to do, and this is what Elsa enjoys. She likes to be able to proviD. her customers good service in every purchase of prepared bread products that they consume from her store. These years of experience have served her to know how to sell and what sales strategies to apply, and that is why she has been in business for so long. In addition to providing her what she needs to be able to live, she has her own income with which she can pay her expenses. Her children are now adults that take care of her, but they are happy to have a mother who is so hard-working. For Elsa this is the second time she has asked for a loan through MFP, in her first loan she was very responsible with her repayments. She asks for this loan to buy various sacks of supplies so that she may have a greater stock of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Adam Kodjo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a trente neuf (39) ans, il habite le quartier d’Agoè cacavéli, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il est revendeur de volailles et de chèvre à Atakpamé, ce commerce est très florissant surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année, il fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au marché local de Notsè. L n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour pouvoir acheter 20 chèvres et 50 volailles surtout en ce »s périodes de fêtes de fin d’année.
Il est célibataire mais il a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mr. Adam kodjo A. is 39 years old. He lives in the Agoe neighborhood to the north of the city of Lome, capital of Togo. He resells poultry and goats at Atakpame. This is a very profitable business especially during the season of the celebration of the end of the year. He has been in this business since 2005. He purchases his goods at the local market in Notse. He has never yet obtained a loan from WAGES and is requesting his first one in order to be able to purchase 20 goats and 50 birds. This is especially important for his commerce since right now is the season for celebrating the end of the year. He is single, but has a child that he is taking care of.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry and goats

loans.name: Nelsa  Zulema

texts.es:
Nelsa  es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Nelsa es de Huanuco, es conviviente tiene 30 años dos hijos de 12 y 6 años ambos estudian en la escuela estatal. 
Nelsa desde pequeña vio a sus padres en los negocios de ventas; para ella siempre fue una inspiración   empezó vendiendo tripita de pollo, anticuchos, ahora se dedica a la venta de salchi-papas, en la puerta de su casa hace siete años, a los sábados, domingos y lunes, partir de las 3pm hasta 12 pm, los días que no sale a vender trabaja limpiando casas, una vez al mes  lleva ropa a la provincia de Huanuco, lleva polos, buzos, chompas, lanas, botas, ella también hace trueques  da su mercadería  a cambió de cuyes, gallinas  y las trae a Lima para su consumo.   

Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para su negocio de salchi-papas y comprar mercadería de ropa para llevar a provincia.  
En Finca recibe orientación a través de charlas para su negocio, a pasado dificultades entraron a robar en su casa, llevándose  todo, hasta su carretilla de trabajo, pero a pesar de todo ella sigue adelante por que tiene un sueños que es poner una bodega en su casa, para ya no estar viajando y que sus hijos sean mejores que ella.
texts.en:
Nelsa is a member of the community bank “Strength and Power”. Nelsa is from Huanuco. She is in a common law marriage and is 30 years old. She has two children of 12 and 6 years old. They study in the state school. Since she was small, Nelsa saw her parents in the business of sales. For her it was an inspiration. She began selling chicken tripe and kabobs. Now she works selling salchi-papas (French fries with sliced sausage on top) in the door of her home for 7 years on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays, from 3pm until 12pm. The days she doesn’t go to sell she works cleaning the home, and once a month she takes clothing to the Province of Huanuco. She takes polo shirts, sweaters, fleece, boots, and she barters her merchandise in exchange for guinea pigs, chickens, and she takes them to Lima to eat. She needs a loan of 1200 soles for her business of salchi-papas and to buy clothing merchandise to take to the Province. With FINCA, she received an orientation to discuss her business, past difficulties were a robber in her home, who took everything, even her work cart, but under all of this she continued moving forward because she has a dream that is to have a shop in her home, so she does’t go travelling and so her children can be better than she is.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and for her Salchi-Papas

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda C. lives in Guindacpan, an island and fishing village in Talibon Bohol. People catch fish for a living and sell their fish to provide for their needs. Merlinda grew up on this island. She also met her husband there and later they raised a family together. She is now 31 years old and has four children. Merlinda and her husband sell fish and plant seaweed to pay for the education of their children who are studying in the mainland. They work hard to support their children and to buy food for the whole family.

Merlinda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fishing materials like nets and fish bait. She will use the loan also to buy the seedlings for her seaweed farm. Merlinda believes that her loan will bring her good harvests and sales. She has been a member of CEVI for more than a year already.

CEVI helps seaweed farmers like her grow their businesses. Those who joined in the CEVI program were given credit assistance for their farms as well as trainings and insurance coverage to sustain their livelihoods.

loans.use: To buy nets and fish bait for her fish selling business

loans.name: Silvia Verónica

texts.es: Silvia Verónica D. M. vive en Cojutepeque departamento D. Cuscatlán,  vive con su esposo. Tras muchos unos años tomando experiencia en la profesión Verónica a sus 27 años decidió poner su salón D. belleza, alquilando un local en el mercado central donD. ella vive, Si bien el salón D. belleza D. Verónica es pequeño genera empleo para dos señoras que trabajan con ella, ya que la afluencia D. gente en la zona es granD.. El sueño D. Verónica es alquilar un espacio más en el mercado ya que a veces los clientes se van porque no hay quien los atienda,  ya que no son suficiente tres personas trabajando al mismo tiempo, es por ello que Verónica quiere ampliar su salón y contratar más personal, para que ningún cliente se les vaya. Verónica solicita un crédito para capital D. trabajo y en la inversión D. ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia Veronica D. M. lives in Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlan, she lives with her husband. After many years of learning the traD., at 27 years old Veronica decided to open her own beauty salon, renting a space in the central market where she lives. Her salon is small but due to the large turnout of people in the area, it generates employment for two ladies that work with her. Veronica wants to rent another space in the market because at times her customers leave due to her not being able to proviD. someone to help them, three people working at the same time are not sufficient. Veronica wants to enlarge her salon and hire more personnel so that she would not loose any more customers. Veronica is requesting a loan to be used as working capital in the investment of enlarging her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru: Клиентка Шаропов Хошим в возросте 33 год, женат имеет двоих детей,имеет высшее образования  по специальности экономист, по специальности не работает, зароботная платан в гос учереждениях низкая по этому клиент, зантмается бизнесом. Клиент проживает в городе Вахдат, клиент занимается торговлей более 10 лет у неё имееется собственнуая торговая точка, которая находится, на рынке Хаир. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, в виде мужской одежды.
texts.en:
Hoshim S. is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has a bachelors degree in economics. Since his profession is not very well compensated in government agencies, Hoshim has his own business. He lives in the Vahdat region, where he has been working in trade for the past 10 years. He owns his own space at a market called "Hayir." He plans to use the loan to increase his inventory of men's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr:
A. Laure est née vers 1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Laure est mariée à LOKO Bertin et est mère de deux enfants: Arnaude, âgée de quatre ans est à la maternelle et Aurelie deux ans. Laure est couturière mais en plus de la couture, Laure fait de la distribution de tissus, de sacs et de  chaussures. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle Laure a besoin de plus de moyens financiers. C'est pourquoi Laure sollicite auprès de ALIDé un prêt. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Laure was born around 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to LOKO Bertin and is the mother of two children: Arnaude, age 4, in pre-school; and Aurelie, age 2. Laure is a seamstress. And in addition to sewing, she distributes fabrics, handbags, and shoes. To satisfy her customers better, she is in need of additional funds. That's why she's requesting a loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, shoes, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M., 43, is a meat vendor in the public market of Cauayn City, and her husband Benjamin is a tricycle operator. They are blessed with four children: Joanna, 21, Bernadeth, 19, Jonabel,17 years old, all being educated at the college level, and the youngest, Benny Jay, 12 years old, a high school student.

When she learned from her neighbors about the Kiva lenders, Josephine was encouraged to request a loan because of her need for capital. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 which will be of much assistance in the development of her business and the welfare of their family. She says, “Productivity gains by working patiently”

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou N. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis janvier 2009.elle tient un atelier de couture depuis plus de 2 ans a la cite mame rane.l'objet du pret est d'investir dans son atelier en achetant de nouvelles machines pour accroitre sa productivite.
texts.en:
Fatou N. has been a member of the village bank of Yoff since January 2009. She has had a sewing shop for over 2 years in the Cité Mamerane. The goal of this loan is to invest in her shop by buying new sewing machines in order to increase her productivity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: augmentation fond de roulement

loans.name: Sabougnouma  Sedougou N’Tjila Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé de dix femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles dans la village de Sedougou -N’tjila qui relève de la commune rurale de Koumantou, préfecture de Bougouni, région de Sikasso, république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce et d’activités agricoles. 
Afin d’augmenter leur ressource financière en vu de  mieux rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, ces femmes du groupe Sabougnouma ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt agricole et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, 8  sacs d’urée et 10 bidons d’herbicides auprès  des commerçants de Bougouni et des forains de Koumantou. 
La  production est estimée à 3 tonnes d’arachide graine qui sera écoulée dans les différents marchés de Koumantou et environs, au comptant,  en détail et à crédit aux revendeurs et aux consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt ces femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA chacune en fin de campagne qu’elles  investirons dans l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is composed of 10 married women who have an average age of 32 and 4 children, on average. They live in traditional conjugal families in the village of Sedougou-N’tjila which belongs to the rural community of Koumantou, prefecture of Bougouni, Sikasso region, Republic of Mali. These women met by working or farming together.

So as to expand their financial resources and in view of making their agricultural businesses more profitable, the women of the Sabougnouma group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their third agricultural loan with both the preceding ones correctly reimbursed.

This loan will be used to buy peanut seeds, 8 sacks of urea, and 10 cans of herbicide from the merchants of Bougouni and the itinerant merchants of Koumantou. The yield is estimated at 3 tons of shelled peanuts which will be sold in the various markets of Koumantou and surroundings, for cash, retail and for credit to middlemen and consumers.

With this loan, each of the women expects to make a profit of 45,000 F CFA at the end of the farming season, which they intend to invest in raising sheep and goats.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of seed, fertilizer, and herbicides

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Ngen S., 50, is married with three children and lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and also sells rice, making around $7 each day. Her husband stays at home and sometime helps his wife selling the rice in the market.

Ngen S. is asking for a loan of $500 to expand her rice stock. She believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: To expand her rice stock

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
"Doña Beatriz L. tiene 26 años de edad, trabaja con la venta de ropa en la feria de la zona 16 de Julio, está casado con don Daniel Pucho Choque, el mismo que es chofer de taxi con el que tiene un hijo pequeño, doña Beatriz vive en la casa de sus suegros.
Doña Betriz tiene la misma actividad que su suegra, la forma de vender es en distintas ferias de la ciudad del Alto como ser la feria de la 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo, los miercoles en Pcota, los dias ordinarios en la Ceja del Alto. El credito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderia, la misma que lo compraran por docenas por esta temporada."
texts.en:
Beatriz L. is 26 years old and works selling clothes at the flea markets in the region. She is married to Daniel Pucho Choque, who is a taxi driver, and together they have a small son. Beatriz lives in her in-laws' house, and does the same job as her mother-in-law, selling at the different markets in the city of Alto. She's at the July 16 market on Fridays and Sundays, in Pcota on Wednesdays, and in Ceja del Alto on other days. She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise, buying items by the dozen for the summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Doña Marina es originaria de la comunidad de Chuicruz del departamento de Totonicapna  es casada con cuatro hijos su principal activida es  ama de casa  con los diferentes vecinos de la comunidad  vien luchando desde hace mas de quince años con dicha actividad, con los ingreso que obtiene alimenta ha su familia, educacion a sus hijos hoy necesita de un credito para remodelar un cuarto que le servira como lugar de estudios de sus hijos,
texts.en:
Doña Marina is originally from the Chuicruz community in the district of Totonicapán. She is married and has four children. She works as a housekeeper for different neighbors in the community. For more than 15 years, she has struggled to make a living. With the money she earns, she is able to feed her family and educate her children.

Today she needs a loan to remodel her dining room because that is the place her children use to study.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of the Kajificheni borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she separated from her husband and she also a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 27,23,20,15 and 10 years. 

Zainabu started her own clothing business selling vitenge,kanga(fabric) 20 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zainabu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of  400,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge and kanga.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Zainabu hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling scrap materials in his community. He is 38 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Santiago, Iligan city. Joel has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Masoda Group

texts.en:
Masoda is the group leader of the Masoda group, which has four members.  All of them want to receive money for their business.
Naw Gull and Norya want a loan for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Masoda wants a loan for her business of leather sewing. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business. Gullahlay wants a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to complete his stock. They are requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Afghani.
With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families in the future.

loans.use: They want to increase their businesses and make a better future

loans.name: Stella Kaimuri

texts.en: Stella Kaimuri K. owns the Lucky Barber Shop, which provides haircuts and styling as well as photocopying.  She has four employees in the shop, and deals with challenges such as power outages.   She will use the loan of KES 50,000 to buy a blowdryer and paper supplies for printing.  Stella is married with four children and describes herself as hardworking, honest and visionary. She wants to open five branches of her shop in areas like Rongai, Towncentre and Parklands.

loans.use: To buy a blowdryer and additional paper stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B. G. is 48 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are grown and married, and the other two are single but independent. She has been running a general store out of her family home in Paraiso (a marginalized zone in Guayaquil) for three years. She sells cooking oil, vegetables, water, juice, cola, rice, meat, and treats. Ms. B. generally works alone from 6 am to 9 pm while her husband is off working as a docker.

She would like to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her shop and to replace parts of her cane home/business with a sturdier and safer alternative. In the future, Ms. B. dreams of opening her own store, helping her kids and improving her home. She is thankful for any support!

loans.use: To buy rice, chicken, oil and building materials

loans.name: Gulab-E- Asel Group

texts.en:
This group, Gulab-e- Asel, has seven female members. Fazella is the group leader, and she is a good tailor. She needs money to buy a new machine with the other materials. 

Maleha wants to take a loan for her brother’s metal shop, who would like to complete his requirements. Jamila wants to take a loan for her husband’s retail shop. Shahesta would like to take a loan for her tailoring business and she would like to buy a new tailoring machine to sew more good design clothes for her clients to receive their satisfaction.Bashira’s brother has got shoe sewing shop. He needs money to purchase more materials for his shop. Hasiba wants to take a loan for her husband’s taxi, which needs a new machine. And the last member, Hamida, would like to receive the loan for her husband’s retail shop; mostly she helps him in cleaning and organizing the shop as well as house chores. 

They have all requested a group loan of 70000 Afghani and finally would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding their businesses and completing their requirements

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian M. is from the village of Punta in Dipolog City. She is 44 years old. Vivian is married and has 3 children. Her eldest child is an adult and the others two are students..  To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a general store where she sells food products in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy more products to sell. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which to use as working capital for a fish-selling business. This will be Vivian's 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and educate her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start a fish-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of baking products

loans.name: Segundo Nicolas

texts.es:
Segundo Nicolas A. es casado, tiene dos hijos, y tiene 46 años de edad.  Sus hijos se llaman Alexandra (7 años) y Kerly (4 años).  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Segundo Nicolas es agricultor desde hace muchos años.  Los productos que más siembra son maíz y papas, y unas pocas legumbres para consumo del hogar.  Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura en la compra de insumos agrícolas.  Sus metas son conseguir más terrenos para aumentar los cultivos y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.  Su esperanza es mejorar los productos para tener mejores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Con su familia, le gusta salir de paseo cuando no hay trabajo en el campo y celebrar el carnaval cada febrero en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Segundo Nicolas A. is 46, married, and has two children. His children are seven year old Alexandra and four year old Kerly. He lives in the San Miguel region in the Bolívar province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture and raise small animals. Segundo Nicolas has been a farmer for many years. The products he plants the most are corn, potatoes, and a few vegetables for home consumption. He is asking for a loan to invest in agriculture and buy farming supplies. His goals are to get more land to increase his crops and that his children attend the university. His greatest wish is to improve his products in order to have better income and improve the family’s quality of life. The things he likes to do with his family are going for walks when he does not have work in the field and celebrating Carnival every February in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in agriculture by purchasing farming supplies

loans.name: Silvia Karina

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia Karina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Silvia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con 250 Nuevos Soles y empezó comprando 02 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. 
En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas, y parte del dinero lo invertirá en azúcar y en frutas para su refresco cómo naranjas en cientos, cocona, carambolas (frutas silvestres y naturales).
 
Silvia Karina, esta muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza, su meta es tener su propio Minimarket de venta de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Karina belongs to the community bank "Honesty and Work" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is married, 36 years old, and a mother of two children, who still depend on her. She has a complete secondary education. Silvia is a hard-working fighting woman, which is why she decided to begin her own business selling carbonated drinks and beverages in a well-kept space located in her house. She directs the business without having a schedule or a boss. She told us she began her business with 250 nuevos soles and began buying 2 packages of carbonated drinks to see how it went. When she saw that the business worked well and she did not have enough carbonated drinks, she began investing little by little in her business. She still works in the same business and is known among her customers, who are her neighbors, family members, and friends. With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, Silvia will buy more drinks like packages of carbonated drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands as well as mineral water with and without carbonation. She will also invest part of the money to buy ingredients for her drinks like sugar and fruits, such as oranges and other wild and natural fruits in bulk. Silvia Karina is very happy with the work she does. Her goal is to have her own mini-market selling carbonated drinks and beverages. She is very grateful for the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her loan repayments and she wants to continue.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying carbonated drinks to expand her business

loans.name: Mauricio Yovani

texts.es:
Mauricio M. de  43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa trabaja en una carreta a las afuera de su casa. 

La papelería la heredo de sus padres y desde entonces Mauricio y su esposa la han surtido con productos comestibles.

Ahora el tiene una papelería muy surtida con bebidas, cuadernos, laminas, cartulinas, etc. Tambien vende productos comestibles. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia en el sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y más bebidas para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere dar a crédito lo que vende.
texts.en:
Mauricio M. is 43 years old and lives in a suburb of Paraiso de Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and only has electricity and water as basic services. His wife works with a cart just outside their house. He inherited his office supply store from his parents, and he and his wife took the initiative to stock it with food. Now he has a well stocked store with drinks, notebooks, paper, card stock, etc. He works from 7 am to 9 pm every day. One of his difficulties is the crime rate in the sector. With this loan he wants to purchase notebooks, pens, and more drinks for his customers. In the future he wants to be able to sell his products on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pens, paper, pencils

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco tiene 28 años , tiene un hijo en edad escolar, esta casado con la Sra. Maura Cuellar hace bastante tiempo ya, viven en su casa propia en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Alquila un local en donde tiene su taller de Bordados y confección de gorros y remeras  hace 10 años en la ciudad de San Lorenzo cerca de la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya., esta actividad lo heredo de su padre que fue quien le enseño todo acerca de esta actividad luego de fallecer su padre dejo todo bajo su responsabilidad. 
Trabaja para varias empresas grandes a quines realiza sus Bordados y Confecciones.
Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
Su deseo es seguir progresando y el crédito lo utilizo para la compra de telas.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is 28 years old and has a child in school. He has been married to Sra. Maura Cuella for quite some time now. They live in their own home in the city of San Lorenzo.

From a rented space, Francisco operates an embroidery and sewing workshop where he manufactures caps and T-shirts. He started this business ten years ago in the city of San Lorenzo, near the office of Fundación Paraguaya. Francisco learned this trade from his father, who taught him everything related to this activity. After his father passed away, Francisco took over all of his responsibilities. He works for several large companies that produce embroideries and apparel.

Francisco is a person has who has made much progress in life. He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have provided. He hopes to continue progressing and will use this loan to purchase fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú, D. 46 años, vive con su esposo  y su menor hijo en una casa alquilada.DesD. hace 12 años, se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, en un inicio salía a vender recorriendo las calles D. su barrio .En L. actualidad ya tiene clientes que siempre  le piden, y paralelamente se dedica a ofrecer el  servicio D. peinados y corte D. cabello, a domicilio, mientras peina no pierD. oportunidad y aprovecha para ofrecer sus productos D. belleza al crédito. Ambos  trabajos le han traído mucha satisfacción  porque le permiten ser independiente en sus ingresos y  tiene L. libertad D. ofrecer  promociones cuando tiene mayor  cantidad D. productos para vender. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un salón D. belleza en un local estable, ya que actualmente ofrece el servicio D. peinados y corte D. cabello en las casas D. sus clientes .Es L. primera vez que tiene un crédito y promete será  muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso D. sus negocios.Marilú tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado  en L. compra D.  cosméticos  al por mayor y también comprará tintes y líquidos para seguir brindando el servicio D. peinados  a domicilio.
texts.en:
Marilú is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and her youngest son in a rented house. She has worked selling beauty products for the past 12 years. Initially she sold door-to-door in her neighborhood. Currently she has customers that always order from her and in parallel she works offering a home hairdresser service. While she is doing the hair, she never misses an opportunity to offer her beauty products on credit. Both jobs have been very satisfying to her because they allow her to be independent with her income and she is free to offer sales when she has a large amount of products to sell. In the future she plans on setting up a beauty salon at a specific location. She currently offers her hairdressing service in her customers’ homes. This is the first time she has had a loan. Se promises that she will be responsible with the payments and she thanks all the people that maD. this loan possible. It will be very helpful for the progress of her businesses. Marilú has thought of investing the money she applied for in buying cosmetics at wholesale. She will also buy dyes and liquids in order to continue offering her hairdresser service in her customer’s homes.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for her businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Aura Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Aura Mercedes T. es comerciante ambulante vende ropa por medio de encargos tiene dos hijas que estan es escuela y por las que se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlas adelante, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo trabaja con guarda de seguridad y el le ayuda a sustentar el hogar.
La Señora T. solicita los financiamientos para comprar mercadería para luego entregarla a sus clientes a la vez ella va comprando materiales para irle metiendo a su casita  para darle un techo digno a sus hijas que le ayudan tambien a ella en el negocio en sus tiempos libres salen a vender con la señora T. y cobran juntas. Lleva 3 años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y siente que gracias a nosotros y a Dios ha podido sacar adelante el negocio  y mi vida familiar ha venido mejorando.
texts.en:
La Señora Aura Mercedes T. es comerciante ambulante vende ropa por medio de encargos tiene dos hijas que estan es escuela y por las que se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlas adelante, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo trabaja con guarda de seguridad y el le ayuda a sustentar el hogar. La Señora T. solicita los financiamientos para comprar mercadería para luego entregarla a sus clientes a la vez ella va comprando materiales para irle metiendo a su casita para darle un techo digno a sus hijas que le ayudan tambien a ella en el negocio en sus tiempos libres salen a vender con la señora T. y cobran juntas. Lleva 3 años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y siente que gracias a nosotros y a Dios ha podido sacar adelante el negocio y mi vida familiar ha venido mejorando.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia ropa para colocar en mis pedidos

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a wife of M. A. and they live in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. They own a small house of two rooms and have been living in it with her family for over 15 years. She has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters.

Jamila operates a sewing clothes business. Her business earns her 5000 PKR every month. Earlier she just sewed clothes of her neighbors but now she sews the clothes of her relatives as well. She uses her income to pay the education expenses of her kids.

Her husband operates a fruit selling business. He purchases the fruits from the fruit market and sells it to the fruit shops. He has been doing this work for the last 3 years.

Jamila is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s fruit selling business. He wishes to start his own fruit shop so he can better sell to the customers and make his own customers.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
K. Julius is very ambitious about owning a big agricultural farm in his home area in Kihani, Ibanda. He is in far cry narrow circumstances that may make him seem like a wishful thinker and this means he faces long odds in achieving that mission.

Julius, however, has at length built a strong attribute of determination that has played into his hands. With strong hardworking skills up his sleeve, he has gotten for his banana-selling business a dependable niche and has banked on this business for the last fifteen years. His family of five children has also enjoyed the good graces that have come with doing this business.

Monthly profits to the tune of 120,000 Ugandan shillings is what Julius has been getting since the beginning. With this loan he hopes to purchase mulches and fertilizers to help improve his plantation and also to buy pesticides as pests like banana weevils have always affected the plantation, hence reducing his yields.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, mulches and fertilizers for his plantation

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, 55 years old, is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. She is married and blessed with 8 children between the ages of 18 and 38. Two of her children are still attending school.

Anna has been farming for 12 years and has only one employee. Her products are milk and eggs, which she sells to the local market. She depends on the income from her farming activities to cater to her family's needs. Her biggest challenge has been the high cost of medicine for vaccination and the lack of enough animal feed.

Anna recently completed her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 40,000 and has requested this new loan for KES 40,000 to expand her poultry project and build a dairy unit. She says that this loan will improve her life and that of her family by getting enough eggs for domestic consumption and sales, thus earning enough income for future progress. 

Anna is happy with the loans she got from Juhudi, which have enabled her to be a farmer.

loans.use: to expand her poultry project and build a dairy unit

loans.name: Simoneides

texts.en:
Simoneides M. is from the village of Udela, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old ans single. To make a living, Simoneides owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing parlor services in the local community. Simoneides has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Simoneides joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simoneides has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Simoneides is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Simoneides from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand her service business

loans.name: Tearng

texts.en:
Tearng P., 34, is a professional silk weaver, making US $3 each day in Takeo province. She is married and has two children living at home to support. Her husband, Yeun Khim, makes approximately US $2.50 every day, making food to sell.

Tearng P. would like a loan of US $500 to purchase more silk to weave.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el caserío Sebastopol del distrito agrícola de Pacanga, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Chepén de la región La Libertad, ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura y al comercio desde que era mas joven, el cuenta con algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen entre sus vecinos. Adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar alfalfa, la cual comercializa diariamente en el mercado de Pacanguilla (un pueblo cercano), con esta actividad el solventa los gastos de su familia por lo que siempre trata de esforzarse para salir adelante .

Arnaldo desea mejorar su negocio de ganadería comprando alimento balanceado para alimentar a sus vacas, esta acción le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos ya que la producción mejorará en cantidad y calidad, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Arnaldo siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, por ello trabaja sin cesar. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is a 35-year-old father who lives with his wife and child in the settlement of Sebastopol in the agricultural district of Pacanga, which belongs to Chepén province in La Libertad region and lies more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has dedicated himself to work related to agriculture and trade since he was a young man. He has several head of cattle, and he sells the milk they produce to his neighbors. He also has a small plot of farmland where he usually plants alfalfa, which he sells each day at the market in Pacanguilla (a nearby village). With this activity, he is able to cover his family's expenses, and he is always trying to put forth extra effort to get ahead. Arnaldo wants to improve his cattle business by purchasing nutritionally balanced feed for his cows. This initiative will help him earn a better income, since the cows' production will improve in both quality and quantity. To achieve his objective, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. Arnaldo is always working hard to help his family get ahead; he works unceasingly for this purpose. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him consider him an honest and hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed to improve his dairy cows' production

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace 9 meses que incursionó en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que lo realiza durante el día. Su modalidad de trabajo es por medio de catalogo y a crédito, cada cierto tiempo acumula los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, procurando siempre hacer trato con personas responsables en el pago. Haydee está muy satisfecha con el trabajo que hace, ya que gracias a ello pudo conocer mucha gente. En adelante desea ampliar y diversificar su negocio con la venta de ropa por catálogos, ya que dejan mayores utilidades. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Haydee tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de diferentes productos de belleza, de esta manera piensa abastecerse y ofrecer la mejor variedad de mercaderías a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Haydee, 31 years old, is a very cheerful mother who lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children. Nine months ago she started selling cosmetics, which is something she does during the day. Her way of working is through catalogs and on credit. Every so often she pulls together orders from her customers and always tries to deal with persons who are responsible with ther payments. Haydee is quite pleased with the work she does, since thanks to this she has been able to meet many people. In the future she would like to expand and diversify her business to sell clothing by catalog, since this is more profitable. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that it is very useful for increasing her business´ working capital. For this reason she is committed to paying her installments on time. Haydee plans to invest her loan in the purchase of various beauty products. This way she plans to have supplies so that she can offer the best variety of merchandise to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Lee Anne

texts.en:
Lee Anne E. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 22 years old. Lee Anne is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Lee Anne owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used bottles and aluminum to the scrap metal dealers. Lee Anne is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lee Anne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lee Anne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lee Anne is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lee Anne from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn Y. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chero De La Cruz

texts.es:
Jesús es casado, tiene 34 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Tumi de Oro del caserío Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Se dedica a labores relacionadas con la agricultura, el suele criar ganado vacuno y caprino para su posterior engorde y venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar como peón agrícola en los diversos campos de cultivo de la zona. Ademas tiene un mototaxi con la cual trabaja en sus tiempos libres. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia.

Jesús desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente en su sala, para comprar el material y realizar los acabados ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir obteniendo estabilidad económica para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor de calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Jesús is married, 34 years old, and lives with his wife and three children in the Tumi de Oro section of the town of Yencala Boggiano.  This is a rural, primarily agricultural zone, that is located in the district of Lambayeque, more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to work related to farming, raising cattle and goats for later sale.  He also works as a farm laborer at the various harvest lands in the area.  In addition, he has a moto-taxi which he uses to provide transportation services in his free time.  All these activities help him get his family ahead.

Jesús would like to make some improvements to his home, particularly to his living room.  In order to buy the materials and do the work, he has requested his first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

His greatest wish is to continue to obtain financial stability, in order to provide his family with a higher standard of living.  The people who know him, like and trust him a great deal.

loans.use: To make improvements to his house, especially his living room.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El Sr. Juan José A. N. él se dedica  a la siembra de granos como frijoles, maíz etc,  tiene  quince años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de insumos y granos para prepararse para la siembra los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan José A. N. works growing grains like beans, corn, etc. and has been doing so for fifteen years.  He has taken out two loans through CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase supplies and grains to prepare for planting.  The CEPRODEL loans have benefited him greatly because, as a result, he has improved his living condition and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and to rent land.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, esta casado con Fernando, de 42 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad de Santa Clara. La actividad económica que desempeña Margarita, es la agricultura, hace ya 10 años que se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra papa y arveja en gran cantidad, la que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”. Pero en campañas agrícolas, viaja constantemente a la capital para comercializar su producción, ahí obtiene mayores ganancias. Ella menciona que le gusta trabajar en la agricultura, y aunque existan perdidas, ella afirma que  “todo depende de la atención que le brindas a los terrenos”. Por ello más adelante quiere comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y está contenta de formar uno de los bancos comunales, más sólidos de su localidad. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará semilla de papa, ya que desea producir 60 sacos de este tuberculo de la variedad “única”, asimismo cosechará dentro de unos meses papa de la variedad “Yungay”, por lo que necesitará abono orgánico.
texts.en: Margarita is 40-years-old and a very hard-working and responsible woman.
