She is married to Fernando who is 42-years-old and the two of them have four children who they care for and raise in their own house in the town of Santa Clara.  The main economic activity that Margarita works in has been agriculture.  For the past 10 years she has cared for her cultivated land where she grows potatoes and peas in large quantities.  After each harvest, she sells them in the central market of the city of Tarma.  But during the agricultural seasons she travels constantly to the capital to sell her crop as there she receives greater profits.  She mentioned that she likes to do agricultural work, although there are losses, because, “everything depends on the attention you give to the land.” Because of this, in the future she would like to buy her own agricultural lands.  This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to be a part of one of the best established communal banks in her area.  With the loan that she will receive, she will buy potato seeds as she would like to produce 60 sacks of the “única” (unique) variety and she will also harvest potatoes of the “Yungay” variety in a few months, this is why she needs organic fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchase of potato seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a young woman from Jineen. She is a university student in her third year. Her husband is the one responsible for family expenses. Reem wanted to continue her education in order to get a good job as she is an ambitious woman who considers education a necessity.

Reem took a loan from FATEN to pay university tuition fees. Reem's husband owns a small grocery store and a piece of land where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables to secure a good life for his family.

Because Reem is a conservative woman she didn't want to have her picture online, so her husband Saber appears in the picture.

loans.use: To pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Juana Maria; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes para el cabello, líquidos permanentes y otros materiales para el salón de belleza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana Maria belongs to the “Maria Elena Moyano” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Juana Maria is 55 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her beauty salon business.  She works from 9.00am to 7.00pm.  Through her business, she has managed to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy hair colors, permanent dyes and other materials for her beauty salon.

Juana Maria is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy hair colors, permanent dyes and other materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Jesus Alexi

texts.es:
Jesús, reside en San Bartolo, Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos Katherine de 12 años, Naún de 7 y Raquel de 5 años de edad, Jesús tiene 35 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de lácteos y cultivo de hortalizas.
El trabaja tiene su propio puesto de venta en San Francisco Gotera, los productos que vende son queso, crema, cuajada, además de las hortalizas, hoy don Jesús está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, quiere invertir en productos no perecederos y que sean necesarios en los hogares de los clientes como, aceite, frijoles, arroz, y lácteos, este préstamo le ayudara mucho ya que su negocio se verá más fuerte y podrá atender mejor a los clientes, también le proporcionara más ingresos para su familia.
Su sueño es crecer  con el negocio, tener un local amplio, además que en su familia no falte la alimentación, y darle el estudio a sus hijos para que puedan  tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jesús lives in San Bartolo, Guatajiagua, in Morazán department with his wife and three children: 12 year-old Katherine, 7 year-old Naún and 5 year-old Raquel.  Jesús is 35 years old and his business is selling dairy products and vegetables.  He has his own sales location in San Francisco Gotera where he sells cheese, cream, 'cuajada' (a compact, cheese-like product) and vegetables.

Jesús is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his business.  He would like to invest in non-perishables that are needed in his customers' households such as oil, beans, rice and dairy products.  This loan will help him a lot since his business will become stronger and he will be able to better serve his customers.  He will also make more income for his family.  Jesús' dream is to grow his business, to have bigger sales premises and to ensure that his family doesn't lack food.  He would like to provide his children with an education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business such as oil, beans, rice and dairy products

loans.name: Trancito Zoraida

texts.es:
Trancito Zoraida V. G. tiene 46 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Tiene 5 hijos de diferentes edades. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Trancito Zoraida se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua-química y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales.

Le gusta hacer amigos, jugar fútbol, y participar de las fiestas.
texts.en:
Trancito Zoraida V. G. is 46 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage with her partner in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos province, and she has 5 children of different age.

The V.R.C. Nuevo Amanecer (New Rising Communal Bank) is located in the San Luís de Zapota precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; it is composed of 12 members who engage in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Trancito Zoraida engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys her products in Ecua-química and sells them in the same place.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She wishes that her all her children will become professionals.

She likes making new friends, playing soccer and going to parties and celebrations.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase school supplies & educational games

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 38-year-old designer.  She designs clothes so as to earn a living.  Being a single mother of two, she works hard to provide for her children.  Roselyne also runs other businesses such as hair-dressing so as to supplement her income.  She was previously doing catering.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has really grown.  She dreams of opening a fashion design school in the future.  She will use the loan of 60,000 Kes to buy a stand for a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: buy a stand for a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, de 39 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Herlinda de 42 años y sus dos queridos hijos Paty de 15 y Melina de 9 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Aunque es muy trabajador, Armando sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz y arveja, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de la plaga, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, tiene el deseo de comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, también comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Armando, age 39, is a simple hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife Herlinda (age 42) and their two beloved children, Paty (age 15) and Melina (age 9). Armando wants to provide his children a better quality of life. Since he is an extremely hard worker, Armando knows that he must invest all of his efforts to achieve success in life. He grows potatoes, corn, and peas. Once the harvest season arrives, he brings his products to the wholesale market in Tarma to sell to his customers. They are knowledgeable of the quality of his crops, which explains why they are bought up so quickly. What he enjoys most about his work is protecting his crops from disease. Armando has been farming for twenty years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting his crops to market to sell since the sacks are very heavy. Going forward, he wants to buy additional farmland so that he can increase his planting.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Armando knows that he must submit his payments on time so that he can access subsequent loans. He is an active participant in his Communal Bank. The loan of 3000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy potato and pea seeds as well as compost and insecticides.

loans.use: Purchase compost, insecticides, and seeds for planting potatoes and peas

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita D. is from St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Ernita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ernita owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling wood laminated frames to community members. She is also making and selling "yema" or milk candies. Ernita has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ernita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ernita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

location.town: St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province

loans.name: Riny

texts.en:
Mrs. Riny R. and her husband, Mr. Bunthan Kim, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have one son and one daughter. All of them are in school. Riny is a weaver, and her husband is a motor taxi driver.

Riny’s sister is a widow. She does not have her own house, and she is living with her father. Riny is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to build a house for her sister.

loans.use: To build a house for her sister

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Felomina is separated from her spouse and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felomina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing, or ukay-ukay, in the local community. Felomina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Felomina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felomina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of used clothing. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felomina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay

loans.name: Adiel

texts.es:
Adiel B. es un hombre de 36 años, que se dedica a la venta de naranjas al por mayor y al detal en la  plaza del mercado de Barranquillita, espacio de gran movilización comercial muy conocido en la ciudad, donde transitan  amas de casa, vendedores ambulantes, empresas y negocios en general; desde allí Adiel distribuye sus productos  hacia municipios del departamento del Atlántico y a todos los vendedores ambulantes del mercado y de la ciudad de Barranquilla, así como a algunos supermercados que también  le compran. Su negocio inició hace 6 años, dándole curso a su naturaleza independiente, porque necesitaba desarrollar su autonomía y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para  el auto sostenimiento. Adiel ha recibido  seis financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha logrado financiar su cartera de clientes,  pues antes solo vendía de contado y ahora puede ofrecer este servicio, pero eso si escogiendo clientes rentables; su meta es continuar ampliando su cobertura en lugares donde hasta el momento no ha llegado y para eso se prepara, pero  mientras esto ocurre continua trabajando con su  ayudante y generando una rentabilidad no menor del 40%. 
En la Actualidad Adiel está solicitando su credikiva para comprar naranjas y verduras al por mayor, pues desde hace 5 meses está suministrándole diariamente estos productos, a los hogares de Bienestar familiar, programa que el gobierno desarrolla en los estratos 1 y 2 del Sistema de Identificación y Clasificación de Potenciales Beneficiarios para los programas sociales,  con el propósito de lograr una atención integral  a la Primera Infancia, contribuyendo con el   mejoramiento de la alimentación y nutrición de niños y niñas.  Adiel proyecta que esta inversión será exitosa, porque está enfocada a aumentar la distribución de sus productos en este programa de una gran envergadura y estabilidad, que le representan a él un impacto positivo de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Adiel B. is 36 years old and works selling oranges at wholesale and for retail in the market plaza in Barranquillita, a large commercial space that is very well known in the city where housewives, traveling vendors, business, and stores shop.  From there, Adiel distributes his products to municipalities in the Atlántico department, all the traveling vendors in the market and the city of Barannquilla, and some supermarkets also buy from him.  His business started six years ago from his natural independence, because he needed to develop his independence and also generate income to support himself.

Adiel has received six loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which has allowed him to offer financing to his customers.  Before he only accepted cash, and now he can offer this service, but only if he chooses profitable customers.  His goal is to continue growing his business in areas where he has not gone yet.  He is preparing for this, but until it happens, he continues working with his assistant and generating a profit of no less than 40%.

Currently, Adiel is asking for this Kiva loan to purchase oranges and vegetables at wholesale.  For about five months, he has been supplying these products daily to the homes of Family Welfare, a government program developed in the levels 1 and 2 of the System of Identification and Classification of Potential Beneficiaries of social programs.  It has the goal of drawing attention to the importance of early childhood and contributing to the improvement in feeding and nutrition of children.  Adiel believes this investment will be successful, because he is focused on increasing the distribution of his products in this large scale and stable program, which will have a positive impact on his income.

loans.use: to purchase oranges and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José es un hombre de negocio, dedicado al comercio desde hace veinte años, como iniciativa ha sido la construcción de su casa, que ha venido mejorando para el bienestar familiar.
Sus ventas son utensilios de electrodomésticos, ropa, zapatos, el cual ha captado su clientela mediante sus líneas de venta dando al contado y al crédito,  Como padre está apoyando a sus hijos a lograr mejores oportunidades con el estudio el cual también su mama los apoya con remesas ya que esta en interior. 
José ha invertido mucho en su negocio el ochenta por ciento de sus préstamos en Afodenic lo ha invertido en compras de su mercadería y un veinte por ciento en la vivienda. La construcción de los cuartos la está haciendo  con ganancias del negocio y parte de dinero que envía su esposa, y ahora con este préstamo será para terminar la construcción y poner techo
texts.en:
José is a businessman who’s been in commerce for twenty years.  Building his house has been his incentive and he’s been improving it for his family’s wellbeing.

He sells home appliances, clothes and shoes.  He has secured customers through by selling both for cash and on credit.  As a father, he’s supporting his children so that they will have better opportunities through schooling.  Their mother also helps by sending regular stipends since she’s abroad.

José has invested much in his business.  Eighty percent of his Afodenic loans has gone into purchasing merchandise and twenty percent has gone to home improvement.  The rooms he’s building are being paid for by profits from the business and part of the money his wife sends him.  Now, with this loan he will finish construction and install the roof.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 39 years old, married to Anne and has three school-going children. He has operated his taxi in Naivasha for the last three years. He also has a fruit and vegetable business run by his wife.
Isaac was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid back all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to service his taxi and restock his fruit and vegetable business. In the future, Isaac hopes to grow in the retail market and open a supermarket in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to service his taxi and restock his fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto de 38 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños en edad escolar labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como colector de ingresos desde hace 12 años. Esta solicitando su 3er credito para seguir mejorando su casa de habitacion, esta vez construyendo un cuarto anexo, pues con el credito anterior lo utilizo para hacer su porche.  Espera poder seguir contando con el apoyo de KIVA y AFODENIC para continuar mejorado su casa y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Cesar Augusto, 38, is married and has 2 school-aged children.  He has worked for the municipality of Juigalpa as a tax collector for 12 years.  He is requesting his 3rd loan to continue to make improvements to his home.  With his previous loan he added a porch, and with this loan he plans to add a room to his house.  He hopes to continue to rely on the support of Kiva and Afodenic, so that he can continue to make improvements to his home and thereby improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la señora Matilde. Este grupo se formo hace varios años y es la quinta vez que estan retirando el préstamo de la fundación  siempre fue un grupo muy tranquilo que solucionaban los problemas si es que existía solo entre ellas, pero van progresando.
La señora Matilde es la presidenta del grupo y siempre supo sobrellevar su cargo, es muy responsable. Ella se define a si misma como una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, a la cual le gusta trabajar, ya que desde muy pequeña ha trabajado y ese mismo espíritu de laboriosidad es lo que quiere transmitir a sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo tales como las ropas blusas, jeans,  camperas y también agujas , hilos , telas, etc.
Este grupo es muy unido y luchador, tienen mucha fe de que este crédito les ayudara mucho con sus proyectos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Señora Matilde. The group was formed several years ago, and this is the fifth time they have drawn a loan from the Foundation. They have always been a peaceful group who are able to resolve amongst themselves any problems that may arise, and they go on progressing. 

Señora Matilde is the president of the group and always knows how to manage what she is charged with: she is very responsible. She defines herself as a very determined and enterprising woman, who likes to work. She has worked ever since she was very young and this same work ethic is what she would like to pass on to her children. She is seeking the loan to buy the materials necessary for her work: clothing such as blouses, jeans and jackets, and also needles, thread, cloth etc.

The group is very united and determined. They have great faith that this loan will help them very much with their projects.

loans.use: To buy the materials necessary for her work - clothing such as blouses, jeans, and jackets, and also needles, thread, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo de 49 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad por medio de unos ahorros que tenia  fue con muy pocos productos y que ya tenía conocimiento de brindar el servicio de carpintería. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad en sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de lija, madera, clavo, maque, martillo, serrucho, tenazas y taladro. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere mejorar sus ganancias y brindarle a su familia una buena vida.
texts.en: Reynaldo is 49 years old.  He is a hard-working man who started his business with some savings that he had and very few products.  He already knew how to provide a carpentry service.  Most of his customers request a lot of variety in his products.  He will use this loan to buy sandpaper, wood, nails, lacquer, a hammer, a handsaw, pliers and a drill.  With the help of the loan, he would like to improve his profits and provide his family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy sandpaper, wood, nails, lacquer, a handsaw, pliers and a drill

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela  de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años aproximadamente Angela se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas, etc) y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades diarias de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con sus ventas cubrirá su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su hogar.  Angela es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por que su familia se supere y logren sus objetivos trazados.
texts.en:
Ángela, 41, lives with her husband and children in her own house that has running water and electricity and is located in Paijan District which belongs to La Libertad Department.  This zone is noted for farming and raising livestock.

For a few years now, Angela has been selling groceries (products that are used daily like: milk, rice, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, snacks, etc) and beverages.  Her business is located in her house for her comfort and security.  Profits from the sale of her products are used to try to cover household expenses and her family’s daily needs.

To be able to expand the business she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy more merchandise her goal being that the business grows and to have more products to offer her customers.  She will repay the loan and meet her family obligations with profits from sales.  

Ángela is a responsible, dedicated, hard working person who is concerned for her family’s progress and that they reach the goals they’ve set for themselves.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her home.

loans.name: Yancy Magali

texts.es:
Yanci, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y su hijo, comenzó con el negocio por el apoyo que le brindo  una tía, su trabajo es de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo para la venta.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa, específicamente ropa interior,  blusas y camisas, esta compra le ayudara para crecer con el negocio, e incrementar la oportunidad de venta.
Su propósito es llegar a ser una vendedora mayorista, vivir con su familia honradamente que las ganancias del negocio le permitan cubrir todos los gastos.
texts.en:
Yanci lives with her husband and son and sells clothing for a living.  She began the business with help from her aunt, and is a street vendor with no fixed work schedule.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, especially lingerie, blouses and shirts.  This purchase will help her increase sales and grow the business.

Her goal is to become a wholesale vendor and make an honest living in order to cover her family's household expenses.

loans.use: To buy lingerie, blouses and shirts for her business.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a 48-year-old married woman. She settled to earn her living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines together with her two adult children. Over the past three years, Marita was able to put up a rice and corn retail store that absolutely met the market primary demands. Until now, the business is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. Every end of the month, Marita approximately receives a total of PHP 23,100 from the store  operations.

Marita joined GDMPC earlier this year to have an easy access to financial services. Her first loan application from the cooperative worth PHP 15,000 has been approved. The money taken is intended to obtain additional rice and corn variants to sell. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Marita expects an increase in sales so as to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To obtain additional rice and corn variants to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 27 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. Two of her children are currently in school. Christine has a business selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Christine hopes to expand her business. Christine is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 66 years old, married, and lives with his wife.

Abbass is a carpenter; he has owned a workshop since 1968. He makes all kind of furniture, such as a bedroom, dining room, and office furniture and doors. He has a long experience in this field; he has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2500 loan in order to buy an electric power generator. He is trying to develop his work by using modern machinery for his workshop.  He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for himself and for his wife.

loans.use: In order to buy an electric power generator.

loans.name: P.paul Eva

texts.fr:
Mme Paul Eva est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. Les trois (03) vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du bissaps, de l’eau glacée et du teedo (boisson local du Burkina) depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionnement au yaar de pissy (un quartier de Ouagadougou). Elle vend dans les Ecoles et les Eglises.

Elle veut s’acheter 1 sac de bissaps ,01sac teedo (pain de singe) et 50 kg de sucre.

Mme avec ses économies aide à payer les factures d’eau et d’électricité et épargne le restant. Elle ambitionne s’occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Mme Paul Eva is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 16 and the youngest is 13. All three go to school. She is responsible for four persons. 

She has been selling "bissaps" (hibiscus flowers), iced water, and "teedo" (a local drink in Burkina) for 10 years. She buys her supplies in Yaar de Pissy (a neighborhood in Ouagadougou). She sells in schools and churches. 

She wants to buy one sack of "bissaps",  one sack of "teedo" (monkey bread) and 50 kg of sugar. 

With her profit, she will help pay the water and electricity bills, and she plans to save the rest. She would like to be able to be responsible for her children's school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy one sack of "bissaps" (dried hibiscus flowers used to flavor drinks), one sack of "teedo" (monkey bread) and 50 kg of sugar.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gasoline to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her retail gasoline business for a year and also earns an income from entertainment (videoke).

Luzminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 43 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children. She is engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. She has had this kind of business for three years. Avelina is thankful because she is able to provide the needs of her family through her buy-and-sell fruit business. She wants to support her children until they finish their schooling, but her funds are not enough because of the increase of household expenses. With this regard, she is asking for additional capital amounting to P7,000 to buy more bananas to be sold within the village where she lives. She hopes that her sacrifices will be fruitful, enabling her to generate a bigger income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for her fruit vending activity.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es un hombre trabajador y dedicado, casado y con 3 hijos, desde hace 25 años se dedica al oficio de fabricar calzado y hoy a sus 56 años de edad, vive solo con su esposa, pero no abandona su microempresa ya que según sus palabras, es feliz complaciendo a su clientela con los zapatos ideales para cada uno.

Su sueño es poder trabajar y ser útil a su familia hasta sus últimos días, por eso actualmente solicita un préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sacar una producción y comprar algunos diseños de sandalias para la temporada de aguinaldos, y lograr de este modo mejorar sus ingresos y proporcionalmente mejorar la calidad de vida de el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is a hardworking and dedicated man. He is married and has 3 children. He has been a cobbler for the last 25 years and now, in his 56th year, he lives alone with his wife. However, he has not abandoned his small business as, according to him, he is happy pleasing his customers with the perfect shoes for every one of them.

His dream is to be able to work and be useful until his final days. That is why he is currently asking for a loan to purchase consumables to bring out a line of shoes and buy some sandal designs for the season bonuses and in this way manage to improve his income and proportionately improve his and his wife's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy consumables to make shoes and buy sandals for the end-of-year season.

loans.name: Rhitah

texts.en:
Rhitah is married and has three children who attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding her family. 

Rhitah rears poultry from her home on retail basis, which she has been doing for eight months. She works seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling second-hand clothes. 

Rhitah is requesting a loan for 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more poultry feeds and vaccines.  Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations are to become a big poultry farmer and to build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of chicken feeds and vaccines.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhjargal, 31, has been working as a hairdresser for ten years. She lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Everyday, Enkhjargal cuts the hair of many customers and lately her number of customers has been increasing notably. This is good for her business and her earnings. But there is problem because her equipment, work tools and other appliances are old. When she has a high workload, her hair machine is always jammed and damaged. Therefore, Enkhjargal needs to replace them immediately. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing new hairdressing equipment and appliances to improve her shop.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing equipment and appliances.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is a 38-year-old lady from the Oruba area of Migori County, situated along the shores of Lake Victoria. She is a single mother of three children who all depend on her for their daily living.

Molly operates a water-selling business in the Oruba area.  She has been in this business for the last seven years.  Molly is taking her first loan from KADET LTD.  She will use the loan to carry out repairs on her boreholes. She plans to use her profits to pay back the loan without default.

Her dream is to build a house for her family and also to educate all her children.

loans.use: To repair water boreholes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Taona Group

texts.en:
Florence is a 41-year old-lady, married, with two children aged 16 and 12 years. Both children are still going to school from Masvingo. She takes care of her sister's children.

She is in the business of buying and selling clothes, shoes, and blankets. Florence has operated her business from home for the past two years. 

She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more clothes for resale, as well as other commodities that might be in demand at the moment, such as umbrellas and jackets. 

Due to insufficient resources, Florence does not have any employees. Besides not having enough capital for her business, Florence also says she is facing some difficulties in non-payments by her debtors. This is due to the liquidity crisis in the country as well as high competition from other well-established business entities. 

She is planning to own a shop in the Masvingo Central Business District. With the extra profits from the business, she will be able to provide good food and a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, umbrellas, and jackets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour, yeast, lard, and eggs

loans.name: 030815-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  She lives and works in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.  Thủy has a manufacturing business sewing clothing. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth for her business. 

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 030815-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Thủy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thủy hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sewing clothing.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Virgen Asunta” del distrito de Izcuchaca de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de la crianza de animales menores, venta de hortalizas, venta de comida, venta de leche, engorde de ganado y otros brindar servicio de albañilería. 

Yuli es miembro del banco comunal tiene 25 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Limatambo pero vive en la ciudad de Izcuchaca, ella se dedica a la venta de comida. Ya son  3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Yuli en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo carne, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, verduras, aceite y otras cosas más. (Las persoans que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografia llegaron tarde a la reunion). 
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends established the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank in Izcuchaca district, in Anta province in the department of Cusco. This bank is made up of several people who are constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead and to provide a better future for their children through their daily efforts. The members of the bank have different businesses, which include raising small animals, selling vegetables, food sales, milk sales, fattening cattle and construction.

Yuli is a member of the communal bank. She is 25 years old and has a common-law partner with whom she has a son. She was born in the city of Limatambo, but lives in the city of Izcuchaca. She has had a business selling meals for three years and it has been going very well. At present, Yuli needs a loan in order to purchase more supplies such as meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, vegetables, cooking oil and other items.

(The two people shown in the lower left-hand insert arrived at the meeting too late to be in the group photo).

The bank members are grateful for the opportunity being provided to them and are committed to making their respective payments within the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, vegetables, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of 4 group leader farmers in Chwele District with Wycliffe selected as the Kiva representative.  Each of these group leader farmers represent a group of several farmers in their area.  Wycliffe has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 52 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Wycliffe is 60 years old and has been a farmer for 30 years.  Wycliffe works as a farmer to provide for his 12 children.  The community and other farmers know Wycliffe as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in community activities such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Wycliffe described his harvest last year as excellent, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  Because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund.  Wycliffe has become more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Wycliffe's life because he has earned profits from harvest, has received more farm training, has more farm group support, been able to save money and feed the family.  In the future, Wycliffe hopes that his profits from 2014 harvests can be used to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Wycliffe and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will continue to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy  maize, millet, and sorghum seeds at reduced prices.

loans.name: Hudson's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of eight group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Hudson selected as the Kiva representative. Hudson has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 90 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings each.

Hudson is a reliable member of the community. He is married with eight children. Hudson is 61 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 38 years to support his family. In addition to this, Hudson is very active in his community and is involved in the prayer group. He described his harvest last year as good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Hudson joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continue working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family. As an active member in his community, Hudson also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Hudson plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school and save for the future. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm group support and was able to feed the family. Hudson is also involved in the community's school committee.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Hudson and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.			

Please note that there is one additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a forty-five-year-old, hard-working married man. He has five children and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle-raising and selling, alongside crop farming, from which he earns an extra living. He started this business, to increase his income and look after his family. He has hardships of competition, theft of his cows, and dry seasons that affect his cows. However, his vision is to increase the size of his farm.

He is requesting a loan. He will use it to buy more cattle for raising and selling.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for raising and selling

loans.name: Juje Pearl

texts.en:
Juje Pearl is 20 years old and is the first of three children in the family. Her mother, Jesceta is one of the client of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc and supports her family through her buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

Juje Pearl is graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Nursing, and is currently reviewing for her board examination. Juje Pearl is borrowing 40,000 to pay for review of her board examination. When she graduates, Juje Pearl plans to be gainfully employed and support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana owns a small market where she sells many basic groceries and other goods. She started her business ten years ago with one sack of rice and another of sugar. She has continuously reinvested many of her profits into her business in order to make it grow. Today her product line continues to include groceries but also extends into basic school and office supplies.

Ana is interested in taking out a loan so she may continue to invest in foods but also to explore sales of new items. She feels that selling clothes from her business may be very successful in her part of the community.

Ana is 32 years old, is married and has 4 children. Her husband has been a construnction worker for about 10 years. Her business has been a great a crucial source of income for her family because many of her husband’s jobs are by contracts and he therefore finds himself out of work for weeks and even months at a time.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Ana is interested in taking out a loan so she may continue to invest in foods but also to explore the possibility of selling clothes.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Five years ago, Arturo started his business of making and selling furniture, a skill he learned from his father. The support he receives from his two children and wife is what has kept him going, and motivated to overcome the problems that arise. Everyday Arturo works hard so that his business can grow, and he can give his family a decent living. Lately, the demand for this furniture has gone up, and Arturo does not have the money to buy the materials he needs, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$750 that he will use for this purpose.

Arturo needs your support and generosity; he thanks you for your help. You can support him, help him grow and keep going. He and his family will be sincerely grateful.

Hace cinco años Arturo inició con su negocio de elaboración y venta de muebles, habilidad que aprendió de su padre. El apoyo de sus dos hijos y el de su esposa es lo que le ha incentivado a continuar y superar los problemas que se presentan. Día a día Arturo se esfuerza para que su negocio pueda crecer y poder ofrecerle una vida digna a su familia. Últimamente la demanda por sus muebles se ha incrementado pero Arturo no cuenta con el dinero para invertir en los materiales que necesita, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $750 dólares que utilizará en esto.

Arturo necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad, agradece que puedas ayudarlo. Tú puedes apoyarlo, ayúdalo a crecer y a continuar, el y su familia te lo agradecerán sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
I have been selling Ice cream during the hot season and corn during the cold season for more than 3 years. This is my source of income to support my wife and children. The loan I’m requesting is to buy more barrels for the preparation of ice cream in other flavors.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo mas de 3 años en el negocio de venta de nieves en temporada de calor y elotes en temporada de frió, es mi fuente de ingresos para sostener a mi esposa y mis hijos. El préstamo que estoy solicitando es para comprar más barriles para elaborar nieve de otros sabores.

loans.use: Purchase of barrels for the ice cream preparation.

loans.name: Khayrinisso

texts.en:
Khayrinisso A. is 34 years old and she has a secondary education. She is married and has 3 children. When Khayrinisso graduated from school, her parents did not allow her to continue her education. She got married and was a housewife and looked after her children. The civil war touched the Khayrinisso family and she was forced to look for a job, but was unsuccessful.

After that, Khayrinisso decided to start a business. She started to sell kids' clothes. When she got a good profit from the business, she started to change the range of goods. Currently she sells kerchiefs and women's underwear as well. It has been10 years since she started selling. To sell her goods quickly, Khayrinisso sells them for lower prices than others, so her goods do not stay long.

For the loan amount of $875, Khayrinisso is going to buy a new range of kids' clothes and women's underwear. This loan helps to increase the range of kids' goods and gives the inhabitants the opportunity to obtain goods for low prices. Khayrinisso is going to pay off the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To increase turnover by selling a new range of kids' clothes

loans.name: Agna Azucena

texts.es:
My name is Agna R. and for a few years I have worked selling sausages. I run my business in my house and I live on the main street in my community so everyone walks by and buys sausages. With the profits from my business I am able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

mi nombre es Agna R. tengo varios años de dedicarme a la venta de embutidos, mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa ya que vivo en la calle principal de mi colonia y todas las personas pasan por aca comprando sus embutidos. con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia

loans.use: To purchase pork meat and sausages.

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en: Nurhayati is 40 years old and married. Nurhayati runs a business selling snacks, household goods and beverages. Her business supplements her family's income, usually earning $2 per day. Her husband, Ujang, has an irregular stream of income. Nurhayati is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan so that she can expand her shop. The remainder will be used to improve her husband's business. She willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To make expand her shop

loans.name: Allangba Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is a 60-year-old woman. Jeannette sells spices and condiments in the Yopougon-Nouveau Quartier market in the north of Abidjan. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Her husband is a coffee and cocoa farm worker in Ouragahio, 260 miles from Abidjan. She is the main resources provider for their household expenses. Jeannette has been in the AE&I microcredit program for 3 years and has performed very well since then.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en:
Yesenia is thirty-two years, and she and her husband have five children, who range from 8 to 15. They all attend school. The entrepreneur lives in Mulo, a neighborhood of Yamasá.

Yesenia runs a little grocery store which she started five years ago. Every day, from early in the morning, people in the neighborhood visit her store to get many kinds of products such as bread, sugar, milk, chocolate, spices, ripe fruit and so on. She also sells fresh meats.

“Profit from the store has been very useful for my family”, she says. In fact, she was able buy a washing machine, a television and a new suite of dining-room furniture last year for the comfort of her family.

Yesenia has requested a second loan to supplement her store's inventory with new products.

loans.use: purchase new products for her little grocery store

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary E. is married with 6 children. She is 46 years old and comes from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells food, and has been in business since 2000. She learned her trade a year ago. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more food to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food for sale

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es:
The business of harvesting corn, maicillo (millet), and sorghum requires great effort since you have to be extremely careful with the process in order to obtain good basic grains that will sell. In the city of Chinandega, in the Somotillo zone, Mr. Rafael A. has worked in this business for the past 10 years, developing great work experience.

Rafael has four children, all school-aged, and as a responsible father he must cover their schooling and other expenses.

Despite his difficult economic situation, Rafael has been able to improve his economic status thanks to the loans that he has received from Ceprodel. He has invested them directly in the purchase of grains for planting, irrigation, and crop control. Currently his greatest desire is to be the best producer in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de cosecha de maíz, maicillo y sorgo requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el hecho que se debe de cuidar muy estrictamente la cosecha para lograr obtener Buenos granos básicos para luego comercializarlos. En la ciudad de Chinandega, en el municipio de Somotillo el señor Rafael A. se dedica a este negocio desde hace mas de 10 años y con mucha experiencia en este trabajo.

Es padre de 4 hijos todos estudiantes y por tal razón debe de cubrir tales gastos por ser un padre muy responsable.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica, el señor Rafael ha logrado mejorar su nivel económico gracias a los créditos que le he brindado Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido directamente en la compra de granos para la cosecha, trabajos de riego y control de la cosecha. Hoy en día su mayor anhelo es ser el mejor productor de su comunidad.

loans.use: To invest in the harvest of corn, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Suvada

texts.en: Suvada was born in 1990 and lives in Živinice. She is married and her husband is a full-time employee with a monthly income of 600 KM (about US$ 485). Their additional income is from her brother-in-law who lives with the family and brings in 320 KM (about US$ 250). Suvada has one child, 3 months old. She wants to use this loan in the amount of US 825 for buying a heifer, in order to improve their livestock reserves from which they have significant monthly income.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena works as a seamstress, sewing things like bedspreads, cushions, and shawls, according to the season. Her home is located in the Alto Pasankeri zone of the Ladera Oeste of the city of La Paz. She is single and lives with her parents. She pays for food, her education, and other living expenses with the wages earned from her job because she is independent. This is the second time she requests a loan from Impro. She will use this loan for the purchase of materials (fabric, lining, pellon fabric, thread). Her work and the desire to excel allow her to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena trabaja como costurera y realiza costura de edredones, almohadones, y mantillas, de acuerdo a temporada. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Pasankeri de la Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.Es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres y los gastos de alimentación, educación y otros los cubre con su trabajo ya que es independiente. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, Forro, Pellon, Hilo) Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, lining, thread, etc. for sewing workshop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. Thi Nguyen, 37 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. She is a determined and hard-working woman, and her family has been able to use the past rounds of funding successfully by investing in raising pigs and chicken. Besides the livestock business, she also sells goods at the market. Her husband is also a man who knows how to shoulder his share of the work, and he works as a day laborer and earns about 1,500,000 VND per month. With Mrs. Nguyen’s and her husband’s two jobs, the family always has a continual income stream each month. Since they have been participating in the Fund, the family has always fulfilled their responsibilities as participants. They are very happy that their participation in the Fund has expanded their business and finances so they can take care of their children and send them to school. In this round of funding the couple is requesting 9,000,000 VND to continue farming pigs. The family’s average income is 3,500,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H., 37 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2003, là người phụ nữ năng động chịu khó, qua các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị sử dụng rất hiệu quả, đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Ngoài việc chăn nuôi chị còn bán hàng tại chợ. Chồng chị cũng là người biết chia sẻ công việc cùng chị, công việc của anh hàng ngày đi làm thuê thu nhâp bình quân 1.500.000đ/ trên tháng. Với việc chị đi chợ và anh đi làm thuê gia đình chị luôn có nguồn thu nhập đều đặn hàng tháng. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị luôn hoàn thành xuất sắc nghĩa vụ của thành viên, anh chị rất hài lòng về việc tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, có điều kiện để nuôi con ăn học.Vòng vốn này anh chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân gia đình chị 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: feed pigs

loans.name: Ana Esperanza

texts.es:
Ana Espernaza Gutierrez is a native of Sandino City in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. After selling groceries for two years, she has realized a measure of success, diversifying her products and increasing sales.

Field partner Ceprodel has played an important role in developing local businesses and for this reason has offered Ana loans to develop her business. Today Ana is asking for a new loan to buy merchandise to re-stock the shelves with products that she has sold out of.

With this loan, Ana will increase her inventory and thus her sales of groceries, thereby improving her overall financial condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana Espernaza Gutierrez es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua capital de Nicaragua. Con dos años de haber iniciado su negocio de pulpería, ha logrado salir adelante diversificando sus productos e incrementando las ventas en el negocio.

Ceprodel ha sido un factor importante en el desarrollo del negocio por lo que le ha brindado créditos para su desarrollo. Hoy en día ella solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de su mercadería por lo que al estar agotándose le es necesario llenar sus estantes de productos.

Por medio de este crédito logrará mejorar su condicione económica ya que al incrementar sus inventarios también incrementan sus ventas en su negocio de pulpería.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise
Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, 50 years old, is a single mother of 3 children who are already independent She provides them with work in her business so that they can cover their families’ expenses and having them along her side is the most gratifying thing for her. Florinda works selling groceries wholesale in her community’s market. She has a great draw as she provides good service and prices that are within reach of people’s budgets. Separate from the stands that she attends to, she has two other small locales of which her children in charge. The purpose for which she is requesting this quantity of money is a loan to expand her business, buy more products, and to later buy a bigger location to put a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Florinda, a sus 50 años es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes, ella les brinda trabajo en su negocio para que solventen los gastos de sus familias, tenerlos a su lado es lo más gratificante para ella. Florinda se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por mayor, en el mercado de su localidad, tiene una gran acogida, ya que brinda una buena atención y sobre todo, sus productos están al alcance de los bolsillos. Florinda muy aparte del puesto que ella atiende, cuenta con otros dos pequeños locales más a cargo dos de su hijos. El propósito por el cual solicita esta cantidad de dinero en préstamo es para ampliar su negocio, para el desplazamiento de sus productos, posteriormente comprarse un local más grande y poner un minimarket.

loans.use: To expand her business to have a mini-market in the future.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años, es soltero, vive solo en un cuarto que alquiló en la casa de su prima.
Es un hombre de gran fuerza y valor, terminando sus estudios de secundaria y al no poder seguir estudiando se dedicó a trabajar, es así que hace dos años su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado que oferta en el mercado dominical, hasta donde transporta a sus animales.El campo siempre le ha gustado, estar cerca de la naturaleza, es muy gratificante para él, la dificultad radica en el transporte del ganado, pero Juan no se amilana y trabaja muy duro para cumplir sus sueños.
Quiere estabilidad económica, para prosperar y en un futuro conformar una familia.
Con este préstamo espera comprar más cabezas de ganado para comercializarlas y generarse más ingresos, para así poner un negocio adicional, que aún está analizando el rubro para éste.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, single, and lives in a rented room in his cousin’s house.

He is a strong and brave man who finished secondary school but who, at not being able to continue with his education, dedicated himself to working. This is how, for two years now, his business has been the purchase and sale of livestock which he offers at the Sunday market which is where he takes his animals. He has always liked the countryside, and being close to nature is very gratifying for him. The difficulty arises in transporting his livestock, but Juan isn’t discouraged by this and works very hard to fulfill his dreams.

He wants financial stability so he can prosper and, sometime in the future, start a family.

With this loan he hopes to acquire more heads of cattle to help generate additional income, as he would like to start another business which he is still analyzing and deciding on.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of cattle that he owns.

loans.name: Chorolque Group

texts.es: En la carretera 6 de marzo de la ciudad de El Alto, se  encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Senkata a éste pertenece la asociación “Chorolque” que trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer   hace un año aproximadamente. Casadas en su mayoría y con un promedio de cuatro hijos cada una. A primeras horas de  la mañana  el trabajo para la asociación “Chorolque” comienza, encontraron en la elaboración de comida  una actividad muy lucrativa ya que anteriormente de dedicaban a otro tipo de negocio que no produjo la rentabilidad esperada, Alejandrina por ejemplo tiene un kiosco  en la Av. 6 de marzo cerca de la Tranca de Senkata, donde ofrece dulces, refrescos, empanadas y otros; Marisol tiene un puesto, donde elabora comida rápida, es decir ella ofrece a su clientela, salchipapas, pollo dorado, hamburguesas, tucumanas y rellenos de papa; Guadalupe elabora las tradicionales llauchas ( empanadas al horno de queso) que las vende de manera ambulante por las calles de la ciudad. Todas tiene el sueño de mejorar en sus pequeños negocios por lo que necesitan créditos para comprar insumos en mayor cantidad, de éste modo incrementar ventas para generar mayores ingresos, en beneficio de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Senkata center, which pertains to the “Chorolque” association that has been working with Pro-Mujer for about a year, is located on highway 6 de marzo in the city of El Alto. Most members are married and have an average of about 4 children each. Work for the “Chorolque” association starts very early in the morning. The members found food sales to be very lucrative. They were previously involved in another type of business, but it did not turn out to be as lucrative as expected. Alejandrina owns a stand on 6 de marzo Avenue (near Senkata) in which she sells candy, soft drinks, empanadas, and more. Marisol owns a stand in which she prepares and sells fast food, such as salichipapas (street food that consists of fries and sausages), fried chicken, hamburgers, tucumanas (fried pastry stuffed with meat and vegetables), and stuffed mashed potatoes. Guadalupe makes traditional llauchas (oven-baked cheese empanadas), which she sells on the city streets. They all have the dream of improving their small businesses, which is why they need loans so that they can purchase supplies in greater quantities, thus they can increase sales and generate more profits, which will benefit their families.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of supplies

loans.name: Husrav

texts.en: Husrav has been in agrobusiness for 8 years. He has rented 1.5 hectares of land where he grows potatoes. He has two children growing up. Although it is a hard job working at the field he works there every day hoping to get a rich harvest and a good profit. He wants to borrow money to purchase bags for potatoes and pay for labour.

loans.use: Husrav would like to purchase potato bags and pay for labour for his potato farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products for her store

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia B. is a single parent and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Felicia sells fruits at Abreshia near Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Felicia uses her income for paying rent and other utility bills. Felicia will use the loan to increase the variety of fruits to meet the demands of her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Felicia plans to invest in her child's education.

loans.use: To increase the variety of fruits to meet the demands of her costumers.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is the mother of three kids. She is a 42-year-old businesswoman. She owns a boutique shop and sells ladies wear like jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags, etc. She has been in business for the past three years. She revealed that the sale of female goods moves faster for her than those of males because men hardly ever buy new clothes.

Comfort says she needs a loan to meet the demand for top quality clothes, bags and shoes by her customers. She believes that, with the loan, she will have more resources to purchase good quality stock to retail to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of ladies jeans, trousers, blazers, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of ladies jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags.

loans.name: Wema

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Wema S. from Mbeya. She is married with two children, who are 2 and 8 respectively. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two orphans.

Wema has been running a retail shop since 2005. Her business consists of buying things wholesale and reselling them retail.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Wema currently earns about 150USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375USD in order to increase various commodities in her business so as to expand her market. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Wema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing various commodities

loans.name: Maribel Del Rosario

texts.es: Maribel  de 36 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijas, ambas estudiando la secundaria, esta solicitando su 2do credito el cual utilizara para invertirlo en el mismo negocio con mas de un año de experiencia y manifiesta la profesora que el credito anterior le sirvio de mucho, pues con el pudo comprar de contado todo lo necesario para el trabajo donde diariamente tiene una venta de C$.1,000.00, quedandole una ganancia de C4.400.00 mas lo que se comen sus hijas, su esposo, la persona que le ayuda con el trabajo y ella, a la ayudante le paga C$.30.00 diarios; cuenta ademas con el apoyo de sus hijas quienes despues de clases le ayudan a prepara las cosas, ya que ella cuenta con una clientela fija.  Su esposo es tecnico en refrigeracion, pero no siempre tiene trabajo y ella tiene que sostener el hogar.  La profesora por la mañana da clases, por la tarde planifica las clases del dia siguiente y luego prepara todas cosas del negocio para vender por la noche.  Maribel expresa sentirse satisfecha con el credito brindado por AFODENIC y cancelara antes de la fecha para seguri mejorando su negocio comprando mesas y sillas y sus ingresos, ya que con el salario de maestro es dificil hacerle frente a la situacion del pais.
texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old, she is married and is studying high school, she is requesting a 2nd credit to be invested on the same business where she has more than a year of experience. She says her previous loan helped her very much, because she was able to buy cash what she needed for the business. She has a daily gross sale of C$1,000.oo and C$400.oo net profit. Besides what her daughters, husband and people who help her on the business eat from the restaurant. She pays her helper C$30.oo daily. Her daughters also help her prepare food, after they get home from school because she has some fix customers. Her husband is a refrigerator technician, but he doesn't always have a job, so Maribel has to support her home. She is teacher and during the morning she gives lessons and in the afternoon she plans the lesson for the following day then she prepares everything to sell at night. Maribel is satisfied with the loan provided by AFODENIC and will pay before the term is over to keep on improving her business and buy tables and chairs and improve her income because the teacher's salary is not enough.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her Fritanga - preparing meals - business

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex E. is a trader. He is married and has four children. He has received a junior high school education. He sells fish in Elmina. He goes to buy fish from the fishermen at sea and sends it home for processing before selling it at the market, which is in Elmina. He has been in this trade since 1998. Alex would then use the money to buy more fish to sell. He would then use the profit he gains to pay his children’s school fees and use the rest to build a house for his family.

loans.use: Alex would then use the money to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with three children and lives in Ntamulung, Bamenda, in Cameroon. Margaret runs a small "buy and sell" stand in Nkwen Market.  With this loan, she plans to invest in more products to sell at her stand.  Some of these products include rice, onions, groundnut oil, beans, tomatoes, salt, palm oil, and soybeans.  Her business plan shows she will invest 50,000 CFA of her own savings as well.  
 
This will be Margaret's second loan from GHAPE.  She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main Market), the variety of her products, and her reasonable prices.  She purchases most of her products where they are much cheaper, and sells them at her stall.  For many customers in her community, this saves the transportation costs and the time of going to Bamenda themselves to purchase these items.  She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
The profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of Margaret's children. Also, she plans to reinvest in her businesses to help it grow. Margaret does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments every two weeks.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Provisions for store

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
LUZ MARIA R. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en el jr misti Mz 5. Lt 7 AA:HH. MARTHA CHAVEZ. del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 39 años de edad, 4 hijos.  Su pareja no cuenta con trabajo, y es ella quien solventa los gastos del hogar.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de ropas de niños y manualidades.  Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró camisas y pantalones de niños, cuenta con muchos clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy continúa con el mismo negocio, vende ropas para niños y su negocio ha mejorado, tiene la oportunidad de vender en su propia casa.  Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más ropas de niños, en diferentes modelos y tallas.

“En la vida tenemos algunos altibajos  y en esta oportunidad mi esposo esta desempleado, pero me siento feliz que en esta oportunidad sea yo la que este costeando los gastos de la casa y esto lo valora bastante mi esposo... Todo esto gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Luz María Ruíz S. belongs to the “Las Margaritas” communal bank. She lives in the district of Manantay in the city of Pucalla. She is 39 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is unemployed and she provides for the household expenses. She began a business selling children’s clothing and crafts. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought children’s t-shirts and pants. She has many customers and her business has been growing. She still has the same business selling children’s clothing, and business has improved because she has the opportunity to sell from her own house.
