With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will buy more children’s clothing, in different styles and sizes. “In life there are ups and downs. At this time my husband is unemployed, but I am happy that I am providing for the household expenses, and my husband really values this. All of this is thanks to Manuela Ramos.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Назарова Махбуба проживает в района Руми. Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет двоих детей. Махбуба занимается бизнесом. Она торгует в основном обувью. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. В месяц она получает около 900 сомони прибыли. Доход хватает только для того, чтобы обеспечить семью необходимыми продуктами питания. В данный момент она планирует увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита.
texts.en:
N. Mahbuba lives in the Pyandj region. He is 30 years old, is married and has two children. He works in business. He sells men’s clothing. He has been in this business for 10 years now. He brings his products from the city of Dushanbe. He earns an income of around 900 somoni per month. The income is only enough to provide his family with necessary food products. At this moment he plans to increase his turnover by getting credit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS.

SE DEDICA A LA RENTA DE LOCALES COMERCIALES.

COMENZO HACE 20 AÑOS, CUANDO SU ESPOSO FUE LIQUIDADO, LE OFRECIERON UN TERRENO CERCA DE SU CASA,EN BUEN PRECIO, DESPUES DE ESO, EMPEZARON A CONSTRUIR PARA HCER LOS LOCALES.

YA TIENE 4 LOCALES , LOS CUALES ESTA RENTANDO.

ELLA SOLICITA EL APOYO PARA PODER COMPRAR PINTURA Y MATERIAL PARA DARLE MANTENIMIENTO A LOS LOCALES, PARA PODER OFRECER LO MEJOR A SUS CLIENTES.

TIENE MUCHO EXITO CON SUS LOCALES , YA QUE ESTAN MUY BIEN UBICADOS Y APRTE LES MANEJA BAJOS COSTOS.
texts.en:
Columba is married and has 3 children. She dedicates herself to renting out commercial locales. She began 20 years ago when her husband was laid off and they were offered a small plot of land near their house for a good price; after this, they began construction to build the locales. They now have 4 locales, all of which are rented out. She is requesting support to be able to purchase paint and materials to carry out maintenance on the locales, which will allow her to offer her clients the best. She has had great success with her locales, given that they are well situated and she offers low prices.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (paint and materials).

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede is a fashion designer and she also sells clothes, sarongs, and tailoring materials. Abosede is asking for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Hirma Bessi

texts.es: La señora Hirma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 69 años y 03 hijos, que ya son independientes y son su gran orgullo.Hirmita, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Hirma, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Hirma belongs to the “Los Próceres” (The National Heroes) Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, Peru. She is a 69-year-old widow and a mother of three children, all of whom are grown up and are the source of her biggest pride. Hirma is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life, and her desire to get ahead paid off with good results. She feels very satisfied today with what she has achieved with her business. She started out selling different lines of cosmetics such as Avon, Unique, Esika and Leonisa, and she's still doing it today. With the loan of 2,500 soles, she plans to purchase beauty products to increase her stock, such as perfumes, cologne, lotions, powders, lipstick, nail polish and another display case to show off her products. Hirma is an example to follow for many women who start a business and with perseverance achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and other bank members for helping her grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Celenia

texts.en:
Celenia, at the age of 46, is a woman full of dreams that remain unattained due to the unceasing hardships in life that are prevalent in the country. She hopes that with a Kiva loan, she will someday achieve her goals and desires in life. She believes that Kiva lenders are the answer to her financial problems in life.

Celenia is married to Romeo S., who works as a farmer in the village of Santos Quezon, Isabela, where her family lives. They are blessed with three children, namely: Romeo, Nino Roeland and Rocel Ann Mae. With her general store business, she is able to help her husband support the education of their children and provide for their daily needs.

Kiva loans provide an opportunity, says Celenia, because she will be able to generate additional capital for her business to improve. For that, she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, and she is hoping that her request will be approved.

loans.use: Capital for a general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Ama Dzigbodi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Avépozo à Lomé. Elle est mère de 03 enfants. Depuis que son mari est décédé et qu’elle est devenue veuve, elle s’est lancée en 1999 dans la production de petits biscuits traditionnels pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Actuellement elle a une clientèle assez vaste et reçoit des commandes lors des anniversaires et fêtes de famille. Ses biscuits sont très appréciés ; il arrive que des gens viennent du Bénin pour faire de commandes. Elle a même recruté 02 nouvelles personnes pour l’aider dans ses activités. Pour agrandir son offre, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 sacs de farine de blé, 05 sacs de sucré granulé, 02 gobelets de beurre de Margarine.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Avépozo neighborhood of Lomé. She is the mother of 3 children. After her husband passed away and she became a widow, in 1999 she began producing small, traditional cookies, in order to meet her family's needs. Currently she has a rather large clientele and receives orders for birthdays and family celebrations. Her cookies are well appreciated; sometimes people come from Bénin to place orders. She has even recruited 2 new people to help her in her business. To increase her supply, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 sacks of wheat flour, 5 sacs of granulated sugar, and 2 cups of margarine.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour, sugar and butter for cookie production

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una emprendedora mujer de 46 años, vive con su pareja, Guillermo de 50 años, y sus dos hijos; Guillermo de 19  y Milagros de 13 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad en la que incursionó debido a su necesidad de trabajar, sentirse independiente y ayudar a la economía de su familia. Rosa vende desde su casa, recibiendo los pedidos de amistades, familiares, vecinas, etc., solicitudes que una vez realizadas tardan aproximadamente de dos a tres semanas en llegar,  pero Rosa, con mucha astucia, compra los productos que vienen en oferta a precios más cómodos y luego los ofrece a sus clientas a los verdaderos precios que salen en el catálogo, es así que consigue mejores ganancias. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda en su domicilio donde pueda ofrecer con mayor comodidad su mercadería.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Rosa con MFP, ella siempre fue muy puntual en todos sus pagos, por lo que se compromete a serlo también ahora. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y venderlos de forma inmediata, sin necesidad de esperar la llegada del pedido.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 46 year old enterprising woman, she lives with her partner Guillermo who is 50 years old, and they have 2 children: Guillermo is 19, and Milagros is 13 years old. They live in their own house. For the past 15 years she has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products, a business that she began because she needed to work, to feel independent, and to help her family financially. Rosa sells from home and she receives orders from friends, family members, neighbors, etc. Once the products are ordered it takes approximately 3 weeks for them to arrive, however Rosa, with much astuteness, purchases the products when they are on sale and at a better price, and then offers these products to her clients at the real prices that are shown in the catalog; this way she makes better profits. In the future, she hopes to have a shop in her home where she can offer, more comfortably, her merchandise.

This is Rosa’s second loan with MFP; she has always been punctual in all her payments, as she commits to be at present. With the money that she has requested she will purchase more beauty products to have in her stock that she can sell immediately, without the need to wait for orders to arrive.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (beauty products).

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma V. is happily married to Rodolfo V.. She is 54 years old and resides in the village of Angoluan, Echague, Isabela. Her husband is responsible for cultivating their rice field while she makes and sells cradles in their village. They have three children and all of them are already married.

Norma is aiming for the success of her business. She is striving hard to make her dreams come true. Lack of funds motivated her to seek financial assistance. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders that she can use to purchase the materials for making cradles. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted by the lenders.

loans.use: Materials for making cradles

loans.name: Kenedy Omali

texts.en:
Kenedy is married and blessed with five children. His brick business is located within Makutano in Eldoret, and his major clients are residents within Makutano and surrounding areas.

He was introduced to KADET by a fellow client. With the loan he is requesting from KADET, he intends to expand his brick business and be able to meet his family's basic needs.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 33-year-old mother of three. She runs a retail business selling dry foods and cereals at Kamuuani market in Machakos. She also earns extra income by running a grocery shop in the same location. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to add to her stock of dry foods and cereals. She employs one person in her successful business.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of dry foods and cereals

loans.name: Hilda Gladys

texts.es: Hilda tiene 51 años, es soltera vive en casa de sus padres. Hilda hace 7 años se inicio en el negocio de la venta de productos de belleza, con capital de algunos ahorros. Hilda realiza las ventas de su mercadería en su vivienda y a las amistades de la zona, a sus clientes les brinda un trato muy calido y agradable motivo por el cual ha ido incrementándo su clientela, la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma zona Guadalupe -Ica, donde ella vive. Hilda es muy considerada en la empresa distribuidora de productos de belleza, solicita el crédito para refaccionar la casa de sus padres en cual se vio afectada por el terremoto. El sueño de Hilda en tener la comodidad, y ver que la vivienda de sus padres no se siga deteriorando.
texts.en:
Hilda is 51 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Seven years ago, she used her savings as capital to start her business selling beauty products. Hilda sells her merchandise out of her home and to friends in the area. Her customers are treated warmly, which explains why her clientele has been growing. Most of her customers are from the same area of Guadalupe – Ica where she lives. Hilda is highly regarded as beauty products distributor.

She is requesting this loan in order to renovate her parents’ home which was affected by the earthquake. Hilda hopes that they will be more comfortable and that her parents’ house will not deteriorate any further.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations to her parents' home

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is 42 years old and married to a pastor. They are blessed with 2 lovely children. She is a hard-working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers to earn a living. She hopes to purchase groceries at wholesale prices in the future to enable her to give a discount to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is from the village of Mabini in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old and married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Elvie's 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
 
 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy bananas and other products to sell

loans.name: Frontier Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Frontier Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 (or SLL 500,000 for each) to enable them to expand their businesses. With this loan they will be able to buy more goods for their businesses; increase sales and consequently improve their standard of living.

Mabinty B. is the leader of this group. Mabinty is 36 years old and is married to a miner with 3 children who are attending primary school. For 3 years now, Mabinty has sold cooked foo-foo (food made out of ground cassava roots). With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients such as foo-foo, palm-oil, fish, pepper, meat, etc. 

(Pasted on the left side of the photo is a group member who was not available for a group photo)

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients such as foo-foo, palm-oil, fish, pepper, meat, etc.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es: El grupo Sorpresa está conformado por Carlos José G. E. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería, Xochilt Verónica P. también tiene una pulpería y Louis Margarita
texts.en: The Sorpresa ["Surprise"] Group is composed of Carlos José G. E., who owns a small general store run from his home, Xochilt Verónica P., who also owns a small general store run from her home, and Louis Margarita

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: staple grains, meat, dairy products, candy...

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia L., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She has been managing her food vending business for six years.

Amelia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than six years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows as added capital for her food vending business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 18,600 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying ingredients for her food vending business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can help with the schooling of her grandchildren. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Lesbia Yoconda

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia Yoconda R. inicia sus labores desde las 6:00Am haciendo las debidas compras para la elaboración de los ricos refrescos que tiene a la venta en su pulpería.
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, cosméticos y otros.
Cabe mencionar que la señora lesbia inicio en el negocio con su mamá, lo que la llevo a poner su propia pulpería. La señora Lesbia es casada, madre de tres hijos.
texts.en:
Lesbia begins working at 6:00 am, buying the ingredients she needs to make the delicious drinks that she sells in her store. She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, juices, cosmetics and other things. Lesbia started working with her mother. This motivated her to start her own store. She is married and is the mother of three children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña  Elizabeth de 44 años de edad es soltera, vive en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea,  trabaja como Conserje  desde hace 5 años, tiene tre hijos mayores de edad de 23,25 y 28 años todos trabajan y tienen su hogar  pero siempre ella vive al pendiente de ellos, está solicitando  refinanciamiento de su nuevo credito con el cual pretende comprar materiales de construcciòn para construir los servicios higienicos de la casa,  y asi tener mejores condiciones , ella es una mujer que se ha caracterizado por ser honesta, trabajadora y de buenas costumbres,  su sueño es  que sus hijos sigan estudiando y estabilidad laboral para ayudar a su familia .
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 44, is single; she lives in Zona #6, Nueva Granada. She has been employed as a caretaker for the last 5 years. She has three adult children who are 23, 25 and 28 years of age. They are all employed and have their own homes but she is always looking out for their wellbeing. She is asking for a new loan to buy building materials in order to build sanitary services (bathroom) in her home so that it will have better conditions. She is a woman who is known for being honest, hard-working and of good habits. Her dream is that her children continue to study and that she have stable work so that she can continue to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene la edad de 30 años por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería es una persona muy humilde, pues siempre busca la forma de salir adelante, ella ha obtenido mucha experiencia con este negocio. Es así que decide que con su pequeña pulpería sobrevivir. Con este financiamiento comprara productos como refrescos, pan, detergentes y pollo. Desea tener una casa más grande para que su negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 30 years old and has been working with the Foundation for a long time. She has two dependent children. Martha is a humble person who manages a grocery store and is always looking for ways to get ahead. This business has allowed her to gain much experience. She decided to start this business because she needed a means to survive.

With this loan Martha will buy products such as soft drinks, bread, detergents, and chicken. She desires to have a larger house because she wants to convert her business into a distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 30-year-old married lady with two children.  She runs a boutique and a grocery shop to earn a living.   She saves part of her income with a group called Halleluyah.  She is a member of Faulu Kenya, which has trained her in customer care and thus helped improve her business.  She has requested a loan of KES 70,000 to increase her stock of clothes.  She hopes to open up more boutiques to increase her sales in the future.  She also dreams of opening a knitting college.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal las Pioneras son socios comprometidos con sus créditos ellos pagaran sus cuotas en 4 meses y así pueden renovar sus crédito.
Auria una D. las socias, vendé menestras y cereales hace varios años, este negocio lo inicio con ayuda en una amiga, ella tiene 2 hijos que mantener, así que se esfuerza mucho por ello. Gracias al crédito pueD. invertir en su negocio.
Albina se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo hace algún tiempo, las ganancias que obtiene solo alcanzan para aportar con algunos gastos en casa, Así que desea invertir en otro negocio con el cual poder subsistir.
Emma tiene un Salón D. Belleza, que con mucho esfuerzo pueD. pagar los gastos D. la educación D. su hijo, su objetivo es aperturar otro Salón D. Belleza donD. poder brindar trabajo a sus compañeras.
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
The Las Pioneras Communal Bank members are committed to their loans. They will make their payments in four months. That way they will be able to renew their loan. Auria is one of the members. She has sold vegetable and grains for several years. She started this business with the help of a friend. She has two children to support, and she puts forth great effort to do so. Thanks to the loan she is able to invest in her business. Albina has been selling cosmetics by catalog for some time. The earnings that she gets only pay for some of the household expenses. That is why she wishes to invest in another business with which she would be able to survive. Emma has a beauty salon. She is able to pay her child’s educational expenses with a lot of effort. Her objective is to open another beauty salon where she would be able to proviD. her colleagues with work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Rady

texts.en: Mr. Rady T. is 43 years old, and he is a villager who lives in Roteang village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Samoun Ros, are farmers who rent some land to grow crops. For this farm, Mr. Rady T. decided to ask for a loan to hire a farming laborer and to pay for the laborer to plow his farm. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Rady T. is a motorbike taxi driver, and his wife, Mrs. Samoun Ros, is a fish seller. With this both businesses they can earn a small income to support their family's living. This couple has four children; one is seamstress in a garment factory while the other three are students in the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To hire a farming laborer and to pay for the laborer to plow his farm.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: K. Christine est née le 07 Juillet 1976 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Christine est mariée à HOUNKANRIN Achille, un chauffeur. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Christine s’est installée depuis sept ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Christine aide son mari à assurer les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité.  En effet, Christine mène comme activité, la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, farine de manioc, sucre, pâtes alimentaires, lait, savons, huile d’arachide, etc.) à son domicile. Christine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Christine exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans.  C’est la première fois que Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Christine K. was born on 7 July 1976 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Christine is married to Achille Hounkanrin, a driver. The couple have five children in their care, of whom three are their own. Some of the children are in school. Christine moved to Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, seven years ago, and currently lives there with her husband and children. She helps her husband provide for the family, thanks to the income generated by her business. Christine runs a business selling various food products (maize, beans, manioc flour, sugar, pasta, milk, soap, peanut oil, etc.) at her house. She buys her products at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Christine has run this business for five years. This is the first time she is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), in order to strengthen her business and better respond to the various demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products (maize, manioc flour, sugar, milk, peanut oil) and soap

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 43-year old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and four little children. One year ago, she opened her own grocery store to help her husband with the family expenses. She is now requesting to borrow $1,000 to expand and improve the store.

loans.use: To expand and improve the store

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena R. is from the village of Laperian, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Nena owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling biscuits, sugar, salt, noodles, candies, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Em Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Em B. is a village bank president who has born in 1975, selected by fourteen people who all are made up a village bank loan located in Bak Ronoas village in Takeo province. Each member will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Em B. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and a side from this she is also a Khmer cake maker. Now she has some problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve her production, Mrs. Em B. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she purchases some chickens and builds a chicken house for breeding to start a new business. She is widow with four children, one of whom is a laborer at Thailand, while the other two are enrolled in local public school, and the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Marleni; ella tiene 41 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, su pareja la abandonó hace 9 meses antes de que diera a luz a su último hijo y desde entonces la socia es padre y madre de sus hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes, en la que vende casi de todo, aquí se puede encontrar desde artículos de librería, hasta plastiquería, La socia también distribuye cerveza, en esta su pequeña tiene arreglo un pequeño espacio para utilizarlo de depósito para apilar las diferentes cajas de cerveza, ella vende hasta pasadas las 10 de la noche, en su barrio hay una discoteca y la gente suele salir a comprar del depósito de la socia para ahorrar unos centavos. La socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su capital y comprar cervezas.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marleni, 41, is a member of the “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA” communal bank. She lives in San Jerónimo district, Chimpahuaylla, Cusco province and department. She is a single mother of three children. Her husband abandoned her 9 months ago just before she gave birth to her youngest son. Since then, she has been both mother and father to her children. She alternates her household activities with a small grocery store where she sells a little bit of everything. One can find everything from stationery items to plastic items. She also sells beer. She has a small area set aside to stack the various beer cases. She is open until after 10pm. There is a discotheque in her neighborhood and patrons tend to come to her to buy in order to save a few cents. She needs funds to increase stock and buy beer. She values and is grateful for the loan granted because it allows her to grow and have a better quality of life. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer.

loans.name: Rosa Lucinda

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Lucinda B. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres en Expansión, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, la gran variedad de su gastronomía, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad y la calidez de su gente.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años, los créditos  le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio y en la estabilidad económica de su hogar, se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a criar animales como: pollos, cuyes y chanchos  que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para sus animales.
 
Doña Rosa Lucinda tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 25, 22, 19, 15, 11, 10 y 9 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente con sus nuevas familias, su cuarto hijo trabaja y con su salario solventa sus  gastos personales y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. Su sueño es algún día llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Lucinda B. is a member of the banking group Mujeres en Expansión, she lives in Cuenca, a city renowned for its natural beauty, its historical district, its rich gastronomy, the four rivers that flow into the city and the warmth of the people. She has been a member of the banking group for 7 years and the loans she has gotten have helped her to grow her business and to provide greater economic stability for her home. She takes care of domestic chores and raises animals like chickens, guinea pigs and hogs, that she sells when she needs to make money. With her new loan, she is going to buy more chickens and animal feed. Doña Rosa Lucinda is 45 years old, married and mother of 7 children, ages 25, 22, 19, 15, 11, 10 and 9. Her first three sons are married and live independently with their new families. Her fourth son works and his salary covers his personal expenses. Her three younger children all go to school and her husband is by trade a bricklayer. They do not own their own home and instead must rent. Her dream is to be able to buy their own home one day.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita R. is from the village of Santa Isabel Norte. She is 43 years old. Anita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2009, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Anita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel C. is from the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Richel is married and has an infant-aged child. To make a living, Richel owns and operates a business venture buying and selling of rice in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Richel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional rice to sell. Richel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Richel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina raises pigs for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unitsoffices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business
